'''Diaspora''': [[Bucharest]], [[Paris]], [[Vicenza]], etc. | coordinates = | causes = * Worsening economic situation * Low [[standard of living]] * [[Political corruption]] * [[Moldovan bank fraud scandal]] * Expulsion of George Simion | goals = * Resignation of the [[Streleț Cabinet|government]] and [[President of Moldova|president]]{{cite web|url=http://infoprut.ro/39097-protestatarii-de-la-chisinau-cer-demisia-guvernului-si-a-parlamentului.html|title=Protestatarii de la Chişinău cer demisia guvernului şi a parlamentului|work=InfoPrut|last=Modiga|first=Iulia|date=3 May 2015|language=Romanian}} * Dissolution of the [[Parliament of the Republic of Moldova|parliament]] * Early elections * [[Moldova–European Union relations|European integration of Moldova]] * Resignation of [[Filip Cabinet]] | methods = [[Demonstration (protest)|Demonstration]], [[protest march]], [[sit-in]], [[roadblock]],{{cite web|url=http://adevarul.ro/moldova/actualitate/protestatarii-dinscuarul-parlamentului-blocat-bulevardul-Stefan-mare-1_561b4ae6f5eaafab2c904b76/index.html|title=Protestatarii din scuarul Parlamentului au blocat Bulevardul Ştefan cel Mare. Dodon arată cu degetul spre Usatîi|work=Adevărul|last=Nica|first=Virginia|date=12 October 2015|language=Romanian}} [[picketing]],{{cite web|url=http://tass.ru/en/world/820923|title=Protesters in Moldova begin picketing state institutions|work=TASS|date=14 September 2015}} [[flash mob]] | status = | result = * Resignation of [[Chiril Gaburici]]{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.com/en/moldovan-prime-minister-gaburici-resigns/a-18513146|title=Moldovan Prime Minister Gaburici resigns|work=Deutsche Welle|date=12 June 2015}} * [[Streleț Cabinet]] dismissed by parliament{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/moldovan-pm-says-wont-resign-ahead-confidence-vote-094738748.html|title=Moldovan Parliament dismisses govt, bringing instability|work=Yahoo! News|author=Corneliu Rusnac|date=29 October 2015}} * 2016 political crisis | side1 = National Unity Bloc

Mii de persoane au strigat "Unire"!|work=Active News|last=Matei|first=Tudor|date=5 July 2015|language=Romanian}} [[Valeriu Saharneanu]], [[Val Butnaru]], [[Mihai Cimpoi]], [[Ion Negrei]], [[Petru Bogatu]], [[Alexandru Bantoș]] '''Others:''' * [[Dorin Chirtoacă]] * [[Pasha Parfeny]]{{cite web|url=http://www.timpul.md/articol/ce-zice-tiraspolul-utag-i-intelectualitatea-despre-protestul-din-pman-79055.html|title=Ce zice Tiraspolul, UTAG și intelectualitatea despre protestul din PMAN|work=Timpul.md|last=Păduraru|first=Pavel|date=11 September 2015|language=Romanian}} * [[:ro:Cătălin Josan|Cătălin Josan]] | leadfigures2 = [[Chiril Gaburici]] (PM)

[[Renato Usatîi]] | howmany1 = At peak: 100,000 (September 2015){{cite web |url=https://www.rt.com/news/314586-moldova-protest-government-resignation/ |title=‘Today everything changes’: Huge protest in Moldova demands new government, president, constitution |work=RT |date=6 September 2015}}{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/sep/06/moldova-protesters-take-to-streets-criticising-mafia-government |title=Moldova protesters take to streets criticising 'mafia' government |work=The Guardian |author=Alec Luhn |date=6 September 2015}} | howmany2 = | howmany3 = 30,000 {{small|(7 July 2015)}}
20,000 {{small|(27 September 2015)}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mediafax.ro/externe/aproximativ-20-000-de-persoane-protesteaza-fata-de-guvernul-proeuropean-de-la-chisinau-14758886|title=Aproximativ 20.000 de persoane protestează faţă de guvernul proeuropean de la Chişinău|work=Mediafax|last=Vidu|first=Valentin|date=27 September 2015|language=Romanian}} | casualties1 = 7 injured | casualties2 = 15 injured | casualties3 = | fatalities = | injuries = | arrests = | detentions = | charged = | fined = | casualties_label = | notes = }} In the spring of 2015, [[Moldova]] faced large-scale protests amid a worsening economic situation and corruption scandals. The protests gained momentum in September, when up to 100,000 people demonstrated in the largest protest [[Popular Front of Moldova#Grand National Assembly|since Moldova's independence]] from the [[Soviet Union]] in August 1991. The protests have been organised by a grass-roots citizens' movement, ''[[Dignity and Truth Platform Party|Dignity and Truth]]'' ({{lang-ro|Demnitate și Adevăr}}), that was established in February 2015 as a response to the disappearance of [[Moldovan bank fraud scandal|$1 billion from the Moldovan banks in 2014]]. Dignity and Truth is led by lawyers, journalists and other well-known figures in Moldova. ==Background== {{See also|Unification of Romania and Moldova|Moldovan bank fraud scandal}} In Moldova, one of [[Europe]]'s poorest countries,{{cite web|url=http://www.eubusiness.com/europe/moldova/factfile|title=Moldova: One of Europe's poorest lands|work=EUbusiness|date=30 November 2014}} nearly 17% of the population live below the [[poverty line]].{{cite web|url=http://hdr.undp.org/sites/default/files/hdr14-report-en-1.pdf |title=Human Development Report 2014 |work=UNDP}} Moreover, with an average wage of about $129 per month, Moldova reportedly has the lowest standard of living in Europe.{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iC_VBQAAQBAJ&pg=PA945&lpg=PA945&dq=moldova+has+lowest+standard+of+living&source=bl&ots=S7LZSLI2Ty&sig=_KzkLanIonl4qr6ky5di2s8ZVHM&hl=ro&sa=X&ved=0CCgQ6AEwAWoVChMIi_LFh674xwIVSbIUCh1ITAi5#v=onepage&q=moldova%20has%20lowest%20standard%20of%20living&f=false|title=Political Handbook of the World 2014|editor-last=Lansford|editor-first=Thomas|publisher=CQ Press|page=945|date=15 April 2014|isbn=978-1-4833-3328-1}} In 2014, $1 billion vanished from three of Moldova's leading banks.[https://www.bbc.com/news/magazine-33166383 The great Moldovan bank robbery], [[BBC News]] (18 June 2015) In two days loans worth $1 billion were transferred in to [[United Kingdom]] and [[Hong Kong]]-registered companies whose ultimate owners are unknown.[https://www.bbc.com/news/magazine-34445201 The billion-dollar ex-council flat], [[BBC News]] (7 October 2015) Banks are administered by the [[National Bank of Moldova]], so this loss was covered from state reserves. This protected depositors but created a hole in Moldovan public finances equivalent to an eighth of the country's [[GDP]]. Protesters claim this damaged their living standards.[https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-34240239 Thousands join Moldova anti-government protest], [[BBC News]] (13 September 2015) The issue highlighted the problem of corruption in Moldova and although the government has promised an investigation, protest leaders have called for a campaign of [[civil disobedience]], a [[general strike]] and a refusal to pay utility bills in order to force the resignation of the government. Likewise, as a response to the $1 billion disappearance the grass-roots citizens' movement ''Dignity and Truth'' ({{lang-ro|Dreptate și Adevăr}}) was established in February 2015. This organization is led by lawyers, journalists and other well-known figures in Moldova. [[Unification of Romania and Moldova|Unification with Romania]] is seen{{By whom|date=December 2015}} as a solution to Moldova's economic, political and social crisis, but also in the context of the [[Ukrainian crisis|tensions in neighbouring]] [[Ukraine]].{{cite web |url=http://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/europe/moldova-stuck-in-limbo-between-its-east-and-west-1.2243253 |title=Moldova stuck in limbo between its east and west |work=The Irish Times |last=Mallinder |first=Lorraine |date=10 June 2015}} Polls up to May 2015 showed 10 to 20 percent of Moldovans supported unification. ===Name=== The protests are dubbed in the international press as the '''Moldovan [[Euromaidan|Maidan]]''' (due to similar circumstances with Ukrainian Euromaidan){{cite web|url=http://www.voxeurop.eu/en/content/news-brief/4927218-moldovan-maidan|title=Anti-corruption protests in Chişinău: A Moldovan Maidan?|work=VoxEurop.eu|date=5 May 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.com/ro/maidan-pa%C8%99nic-la-chi%C8%99in%C4%83u-demonstra%C8%9Bie-de-amploare-%C3%AEmpotriva-guvernan%C8%9Bilor/a-18697205|title="Maidan" pașnic la Chișinău: demonstrație de amploare împotriva guvernanților|work=Deutsche Welle|last=Călugăreanu|first=Vitalie|date=7 September 2015|language=Romanian}} and '''Anti-oligarchic movement'''.{{cite web|url=http://jurnal.md/en/politic/2015/9/7/saakashvili-protests-from-chisinau-an-anti-oligarchic-movement-moldovans-are-sick-of-clans-and-corruption/|title=Saakashvili: "Protests from Chişinău – an anti-oligarchic movement; Moldovans are sick of clans and corruption"|work=Jurnal.md|date=7 September 2015}}{{cite journal|url=http://www.jamestown.org/regions/europe/moldova/|title=Toppling Moldova’s Government: Popular Movement or Political Operation?|last=Socor|first=Vladimir|publicationdate=9 September 2015|volume=12|issue=161|publisher=Eurasia Daily Monitor|journal=The Jamestown Foundation}} In Moldova, media outlets cataloged the events as a '''Red Revolution''', due to involvement of communist and socialist parties in the protests.{{cite web|url=http://unimedia.info/stiri/revolutia-rosie--dupa-ce-au-blocat-centrul-capitalei--dodon-si-usatii-vor-sa-paralizeze-drumurile-nationale-101987.html|title=Revoluția roșie. După ce au blocat centrul capitalei, Dodon și Usatîi vor să paralizeze drumurile naționale|work=Unimedia|date=3 October 2015|language=Romanian}} ===Protesters' profile=== The protesters have formed two distinct camps: pro-European sympathizers and those who support pro-Russian parties. But while they may be separated by aspirations and ideologies, both sides have similar aims: the resignation of the government, the conviction of corrupt oligarchs and early elections.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/moldovas-maidan-echoes-ukraine-crisis-amid-anti-corruption-protest-movement-1523124|title=Moldova's Maidan: Echoes of Ukraine crisis amid anti-corruption protest movement|work=International Business Times|date=8 October 2015}} For those in the pro-Russian camp, the corruption cases have provoked a crisis of confidence in the European project. Moldova signed an association agreement with the [[European Union]] in 2013, committing to core reforms, economic recovery, sector cooperation and justice, but anti-European sentiment is growing. An April 2015 poll found that 32% of Moldovans favoured joining the EU, a decrease of 46 percent compared to 78% in 2007.{{cite web|url=http://www.mediafax.ro/externe/ue-pare-sa-piarda-lupta-cu-rusia-pentru-republica-moldova-14311781|title=UE pare să piardă lupta cu Rusia pentru Republica Moldova|work=Mediafax|last=Enache|first=Iuliana|date=21 May 2015|language=Romanian}} == Timeline == === Farmers' protests === The National Farmers Federation of Moldova, the Republican Association ''UniAgroProtect'', the National Farmers Federation ''AGROinform'' and the Association ''Moldova-Fruct'' organized on 27 March and 15 April protest action by farmers throughout the country.{{cite web|url=http://agora.md/stiri/8134/fermierii-ameninta-cu-blocarea-tuturor-intrarilor-in-chisinau |title=Fermierii amenință cu blocarea tuturor intrărilor în Chișinău|work=Agora|date=27 April 2015|language=Romanian}} According to organizers, the protests mobilized more than 5,000 farmers. They blocked national roads with agricultural machinery. Farmers oppose a VAT increase from 8% to 20% and demand swift access to a credit line of nearly €100 million offered by [[Poland]] with a subsidized interest rate.{{cite web|url=http://stiri.tvr.ro/mii-de-fermieri-din-republica-moldova-au-protestat-cu-utilajele-pe-drumurile-nationale_58400.html|title=Mii de fermieri din Republica Moldova au protestat cu utilajele pe drumurile naţionale|work=Ştirile TVR|date=27 March 2015|language=Romanian}} Farmers say that, because of the devaluation of the [[Moldovan leu|leu]], resulting from ''de facto'' nationalization of the banks at the heart of the economic crisis, they can't service outstanding loans. They had several meetings with the Prime Minister, the Minister of Agriculture and the Minister of Finance, but were not satisfied with the result.{{cite web|url=http://www.europalibera.org/content/article/26924326.html|title=Mii de fermieri au protestat în R. Moldova, cerând subvenții mai mari pentru agricultură|work=Radio Europa Liberă|last=Basiul|first=Valentina|date=27 March 2015|language=Romanian}}{{cite web|url=http://protv.md/stiri/social/ministerul-agriculturii-nu-cedeaza-chiar-daca-fermierii-ameninta---929231.html|title=Ministerul Agriculturii NU cedeaza: Chiar daca fermierii ameninta cu proteste, nimic NU mai poate fi schimbat: "Asa a decis Guvernul"|work=Stirile Pro TV|date=10 April 2015|language=Romanian}} The farmers' demands include replenishment of subsidy funds in 2015 to 1.2 billion lei, the release of the lending process in agriculture and the decrease of the lending interest rate.{{cite web|url=http://agora.md/stiri/7763/foto--mai-multe-trasee-nationale--blocate--fermierii-protesteaza-pentru-a-si-revendica-drepturile|title=Mai multe trasee naționale, BLOCATE. Fermierii protestează pentru a-şi revendica drepturile|work=Agora|date=15 April 2015|language=Romanian}} === 5 April demonstration === [[File:Protestul Platformei „DA” (5 aprilie 2015) (2).jpg|thumb|left|200px|Protest of DA Platform in Chișinău, on 5 April]] Tens of thousands of people across the country gathered in downtown Chișinău, at the call of the ''Dignity and Truth'' Platform, in an action of protest against the collapse of the financial and banking system, but also against judicial corruption.{{cite web|url=http://www.jurnal.md/ro/social/2015/4/5/proteste-de-amploare-la-chisinau-mii-de-oameni-au-scandat-hotii-de-la-guvernare-la-puscarie/ |title=Proteste de amploare la Chişinău; Mii de oameni au scandat: "Hoţii de la guvernare, la puşcărie!"|work=Jurnal.md|date=5 April 2015|language=Romanian}} Demonstrators chanted slogans against the government led by [[Chiril Gaburici]] and demanded the unification of Romania and Moldova.{{cite web|url=http://www.digi24.ro/Stiri/Digi24/Extern/Europa/Protest+Chisinau+Republica+Moldova+violente+7+aprilie+2009|title=Mii de persoane au protestat la Chişinău, la şase ani de la violenţele din aprilie 2009|work=Digi24|date=5 April 2015|language=Romanian}} Gaburici resigned on 22 June after an investigation into alleged fraud in his educational qualifications and was replaced permanently by [[Valeriu Streleț]] on 30 July. === 3 May demonstration === {{ external media | float = right | width = | image1 = [http://pesurse.md/mitingul-de-protest-din-centrul-capitalei-in-imagini/ Protest rally in the capital's center in pictures] on ''PS News'' | image2 = [http://www.jurnal.md/ro/social/2015/9/6/fotoreportaj-marea-adunare-nationala-din-6-septembrie/ Great National Gathering of 6 September] on ''[[Jurnal TV|Jurnal.md]]'' | image3 = [https://trm.md/ro/social/protestul-din-pman-in-imagini/ Protest in PMAN in pictures] on ''[[TeleRadio-Moldova|TeleRadio Moldova]]'' | audio1 = | audio2 = | audio3 = | video1 = {{YouTube |id=_RvWwM6WaT4 |title=Popular protest against thieves in government}} | video2 = {{YouTube |id=djV_J8yzLls |title="Union will take place over the next two years. Are you ready?"}} | video3 = {{YouTube |id=5YIqs63auEI |title=Meeting of 7 June}} | video4 = [http://www.rferl.org/media/video/moldova-protests-corruption/27246638.html Anticorruption Protests Surge In Moldova] on ''[[Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty|RFE/RL]]'' | video5 = [http://moldova24.info/2015/09/no-comment-imagini-de-la-protestul-da-filmate-cu-drona/ Pictures of the DA protest, coated with drone] on ''Moldova24'' }} On 3 May, up to 50,000 people protested against the [[Government of Moldova]], saying it had failed to implement reforms to bring the country closer to the [[European Union]]. Protesters also called on the government to investigate the disappearance of $1 billion (nearly 1/8 of the country's GDP){{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2015/05/05/kiev-ukraine-moldova-globalpost/26923909/ |title=Someone stole $1B from Moldova — an eighth of its GDP |work=USA Today |last=Peleschuk |first=Dan |date=5 May 2015}}{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/moldovas-missing-1bn-sparks-protests-against-countrys-government-10231115.html |title=Moldova's missing $1bn sparks protests against country's government |work=The Independent |last=O'Connor |first=Roisin |date=7 May 2015}} from the state-owned Savings Bank and the private banks ''Unibank'', ''Banca de Economii'' and ''Banca Socială'', in November 2014 before [[Moldovan parliamentary election, 2014|parliamentary elections]].{{cite web |url=http://www.rferl.org/content/moldova-bank-scandal-economy/26973772.html |title=Moldova's Missing Millions: Massive Bank Scandal Roils Chisinau |work=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty |last=Baker |first=Mark |date=23 April 2015}} The central bank commissioned risk consultancy [[Kroll Inc.|Kroll]] to conduct a preliminary investigation into the activities of the three stricken banks. Their findings were confidential but on 4 May parliament speaker [[Andrian Candu]] published what he said was Kroll's report on his website. "There appears to have been a deliberate plan to gain control of each of the banks and subsequently manipulate transactions to gain access to credit, whilst giving the appearance to the contrary", the report said.{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/05/05/us-moldova-corruption-banks-idUSKBN0NQ1XD20150505 |title=Moldova seeks to solve riddle of missing $1 billion |work=Reuters |last=Tanas |first=Alexander |date=5 May 2015}} The protest activities were mobilized by the newly founded citizen platform called "Dignity and Truth" – allegedly financed by Viorel and Victor Topa, two exiled businessmen – to which leading personalities in Moldovan civil society belong.{{cite web |url=http://www.dw.de/spring-again-in-the-republic-of-moldova-mass-protest-against-corruption/a-18428422 |title=Spring again in the Republic of Moldova – mass protest against corruption |work=Deutsche Welle |last1=Calugareanu |first1=Vitalie |last2=Schwartz |first2=Robert |date=4 May 2015}} === Expulsion of George Simion === A protest took place on 14 May, in [[Bucharest]], in front of the Embassy of the Republic of Moldova, calling for an "urgent revocation of abusive measures" taken by the Chișinău authorities against Romanian citizen George Simion.{{cite web |url=http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/eveniment/protest-fata-de-expulzarea-lui-george-simion-din-r--moldova-378421 |title=Protest faţă de expulzarea lui George Simion din R. Moldova |work=România Liberă |last=Dolana |first=Andra |date=14 May 2015 |language=Romanian}} The measure was seen as an attempt to intimidate the protest announced for 16 May. Simion had come to Moldova to help organize and take part in the march. He was expelled for five years on 14 May on grounds that his activities could endanger national security.[http://www.rferl.mobi/a/27020131.html Thousands Rally In Moldova For Unification With Romania], [[Radio Free Europe]] (15 May 2015) Despite this, more than 25,000 people gathered in Grand National Assembly Square{{cite web |url=http://www.rferl.org/content/moldova-unification-rally-chisinau-romania/27020131.html |title=Thousands Rally In Moldova For Unification With Romania |work=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty |date=16 May 2015}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.libertatea.ro/detalii/articol/prosteste-chisinau-unirea-cu-romania-536305.html |title=Peste 25.000 de oameni au protestat ÎN CENTRUL CHIȘINĂULUI. MOLDOVENII au cerut unirea cu ROMÂNIA |work=Libertatea |date=16 May 2015 |language=Romanian}} in the largest pro-Romanian manifestation in Chișinău in recent years.{{cite web |url=http://www.timpul.md/articol/cel-mai-mare-protest-pro-romanesc-la-chiinau-din-istoria-recenta--o-mare-adunare-naionala-anunata-pentru-5-iulie---video-74423.html |title=Cel mai mare PROTEST pro-românesc la Chișinău din istoria recentă. O MARE ADUNARE NAȚIONALĂ anunțată pentru 5 iulie |work=Timpul.md |date=16 May 2015 |language=Romanian}} Most of the protesters were young people and intellectuals.{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/europa/moldova/rusia-nu-uita-basarabia-nu-i-a-ta-zeci-de-mii-de-moldoveni-au-cerut-unirea-duminica-vin-spre-romania-galerie-foto-1363555 |title="Rusia, nu uita, Basarabia nu-i a ta" - Zeci de mii de moldoveni au cerut Unirea. Duminica vin spre Romania |work=Ziare.com |last=Robu |first=Diana |date=16 May 2015 |language=Romanian}} They demanded the unification of Romania and Moldova and displayed placards with unionist and anti-Russian messages. Demonstrators were joined, among others, by Mayor of Chișinău [[Dorin Chirtoacă]].{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/international/peste-25-000-de-oameni-s-au-strans-in-centrul-chisinaului-la-un-miting-pentru-unirea-cu-romania-imagini-live-video.html |title=Peste 25.000 de oameni au participat, la Chisinau, la un miting pentru unirea cu Romania: "Armata rusa afara!" |work=Stirile Pro TV |date=16 May 2015 |language=Romanian}} Column of protesters made several stops in front of the embassies of [[Romania]], [[Germany]], the [[United States]] and [[Russia]]. Participants at the unionist march voted for the formation of the ''National Unity Bloc'' ({{lang-ro|Blocul Unității Naționale}}), adjoining 22 non-governmental entities, including: Civic Movement ''Youth of Moldova'', Unionist Platform ''Action 2012'', Association ''Light'' of Transnistrian Teachers, Queen Helen Foundation, Children Charity Foundation ''Sidereal Moment'', Association of Former Deportees in USSR, Association ''Tiras-Bender'', etc.{{cite web |url=http://www.revista22.ro/25000-de-oameni-participa-la-chisinau-la-un-miting-pentru-unirea-cu-romania-55845.html |title=25.000 de oameni participa la Chisinau la un miting pentru unirea cu Romania |work=Revista 22 |last=C. |first=P. |date=16 May 2015 |language=Romanian}} The march ended with the signing of a Pact of Union, Pact for Europe.{{cite web |url=http://stiri.tvr.ro/chisinau--peste-20-de-mii-de-oameni-au-cerut-integrarea-europeana-a-moldovei-si-unirea-cu-romania_60473.html |title=Chişinău: Peste 20 de mii de oameni au cerut integrarea europeană a Moldovei şi unirea cu România |work=Ştirile TVR |date=16 May 2015 |language=Romanian}} A bus with 50 members of the Moldovan Youth organization and others who wanted to attend the rally were blocked and legitimated by police in [[Cahul]]. Meanwhile, about 40 high school students from [[Florești, Moldova|Florești]] were warned by telephone, through parents, by the police that if they participate in demonstrations on 16 May, they would suffer as during the [[2009 Moldova civil unrest|protests of 7 April 2009]].{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/moldova/actualitate/politiaincearca-blocheze-marsul-unirii-1_555726d1cfbe376e3541dc02/index.html |title=Poliţia încearcă să blocheze Marşul Unirii |work=Adevărul |last=Filimon |first=Alexandru |date=16 May 2015 |language=Romanian}} Romanian Prime Minister [[Victor Ponta]] conducted a visit to Chișinău on the occasion of Moldovan Independence Day, being greeted by about 200 young men with masks featuring George Simion. "We want to see justice done in the case of George Simion, we want functional justice and we believe that true sovereignty, independence and freedom can only be achieved through union", stated Anatol Ursu, one of the organizers of the [[flash mob]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evzmd.md/politica/268-politic/26465-ponta,-intampinat-la-chi%C8%99inau-intr-un-mod-inedit.html |title=Ponta, întâmpinat la Chișinău într-un mod inedit |work=Evenimentul Zilei |last=Moraru |first=Anatol |date=27 August 2015 |language=Romanian}} After pressure from civil society and Romanian Foreign Minister [[Bogdan Aurescu]], Chișinău Court of Appeal decided, on 18 September, to lift the ban imposed on George Simion.{{cite web |url=http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/eveniment/r--moldova--autoritatile-au-ridicat-interdictia-impusa-liderului-platformei-unioniste-actiunea-2012-393393?c=q2562 |title=R. Moldova: Autorităţile AU RIDICAT interdicţia impusă lui George Simion, liderul Platformei Unioniste |work=România Liberă |last=Filimon |first=Paul |date=18 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} On 22 September, Romanian and Moldovan governments met in joint session, in [[Neptun, Romania|Neptun]]. At the same time, over 300 people gathered outside the building where the meeting was held, demanding unification of Moldova with Romania.{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/protest-in-neptun--unde-are-loc-sedinta-de-guvern-romano-moldoveana--vrem-unirea--dna--treci-prutul_246019.html |title=INCIDENTE la Neptun, înaintea şedinţei de Guvern România-Moldova: Unioniştii s-au îmbrâncit cu jandarmii |work=România TV |last=Tudor |first=Iulian |date=22 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} Before the meeting began, protesters tried to force the cordon of gendarmes to get closer to the building, and some of them jostled with law enforcers. The heads of the two governments agreed to talk to the unionists. === March of Stephen the Great === [[File:Potential union of Romania and Moldova including Transnistria.png|thumb|200px|Unified Romania, including [[Transnistria]], as envisaged by unionists]] On 5 July 2015, up to 30,000 people, according to organizers, gathered in Grand National Assembly Square, [[Chișinău]], facing Government House and the [[Monument to the Victims of the Soviet Occupation]], to demand the unification of Romania and Moldova. Participants chanted unionist slogans and voted symbolically for a union. Organized by Unionist Platform "Action 2012" and Youth of Moldova, the manifestation was claimed to be one of the largest in the recent history of Moldova and the fourth great national gathering after those of 27 August 1989 (calling for a restoration of the [[Latin script]]), 16 December 1990 (in support of changing the name of the state to [[Republic of Moldova]]) and 27 August 1991 (celebrating the [[Moldovan Declaration of Independence|proclamation of independence]] from the [[USSR]]).{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/moldova/actualitate/livetext-video-zi-istorica-republica-moldova-chisinau-moldovenii-cer-unirea-romania-1_5598e541f5eaafab2c415a44/index.html |title=Zi istorică pentru Republica Moldova. La Chişinău, moldovenii au cerut unirea cu România. Aceştia speră să o sărbătorească în 2018 |work=Adevărul |last1=Stimpovschii |first1=Doina |last2=Vasiliu |first2=Vadim |date=5 July 2015 |language=Romanian}} Among participants were present Members of the [[Romanian Parliament]] and Moldovans from the Diaspora. Thousands of young people among the participants in the Great National Gathering headed to [[Bucharest]] in the '''March of Stephen the Great''' ({{lang-ro|Marșul lui Ștefan cel Mare}}) calling for the unification of Moldova with Romania. The march lasted a week, from 5 to 11 July. In the Republic of Moldova, the march followed the route [[Strășeni]]–[[Lozova]]–[[Călărași]]–[[Cornești, Moldova|Cornești]]–[[Ungheni]].{{cite web |url=http://infoprut.ro/40472-marsul-lui-stefan-cel-mare-mii-de-tineri-dintre-participantii-la-man-au-plecat-pe-jos-spre-bucuresti-pentru-unire.html |title=Mii de tineri dintre participanţii la MAN au plecat pe jos spre Bucureşti pentru unire |work=InfoPrut |last=Stan |first=Liviu G. |date=5 July 2015 |language=Romanian}} Participants crossed the [[Prut River]], on 11 July, at 10 a.m., in a large-scale reenactment of the [[Bridge of Flowers (event)|Bridges of Flowers]] in 1990.{{cite web |url=http://www.agerpres.ro/externe/2015/07/05/marea-adunare-nationala-de-la-chisinau-30-000-de-participanti-17-38-19 |title=Marea Adunare Națională de la Chișinău: 30.000 de participanți |work=Agerpres |date=5 July 2015 |language=Romanian}} Their march ended in [[Bucharest]], where were greeted by several hundred Romanian citizens in [[University Square, Bucharest|University Square]], before making their way to the [[Cotroceni Palace]] to call on Romanian President [[Klaus Iohannis]] to support the unification project.{{cite web |url=http://uatoday.tv/society/supporters-of-moldova-rsquo-s-union-with-romania-finish-week-long-march-455454.html |title=Supporters of Moldova's union with Romania finish week-long march |work=Ukraine Today |date=13 July 2015}} Former Moldovan President [[Vladimir Voronin]] has sharply condemned the march to Romania. In a letter to [[European Parliament]] President [[Martin Schulz]], released on 7 July, Voronin accused Bucharest of fomenting "the destruction and annexation of Moldova".{{cite web |url=http://www.eurasianet.org/node/74176 |title=Moldova: Pondering Unification with Romania? |work=EurasiaNet.org |date=10 July 2015}} === Autumn protests === [[File:September 2015 protests in Moldova.png|thumb|200px|Tens of thousands demonstrating in central Chișinău on 6 September]] [[File:September 11, 2015 protests in Moldova.png|thumb|200px|Tents installed in the town of "Dignity and Freedom", as protesters dubbed their encampment in front of PM office.{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/international/manifestatia-anticoruptie-continua-la-chisinau-30-de-corturi-au-fost-instalate-in-oraselul-demnitatii-si-libertatii.html |title=Manifestatia anticoruptie continua la Chisinau. 30 de corturi au fost instalate in oraselul "Demnitatii si Libertatii" |work=Stirile Pro TV |date=7 September 2015 |language=Romanian}}]] [[File:Chisinau,Protests2015-09-06.jpg|thumb|200px|Demonstrators marching with anti-oligarchic banners on Alexander Pushkin Street]] Tens of thousands of people{{cite web |url=http://www.euronews.com/2015/09/06/moldovans-protest-over-banking-scandal-in-a-rare-show-of-defiance/ |title=Moldovans protest over banking scandal in a rare show of defiance |work=Euronews |date=6 September 2015}}{{cite web |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/moldovans-demand-investigation-into-missing-money-1441573042 |title=Moldovans Demand Investigation Into Missing Money |work=The Wall Street Journal |date=6 September 2015}} manifested in Chișinău at the call of the Justice and Truth Platform.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/international/zeci-de-mii-de-persoane-cer-la-chisinau-demisia-presedintelui-timofti-14702174 |title=Zeci de mii de persoane cer la Chişinău demisia preşedintelui Timofti |work=Gândul |last=Vidu |first=Valentin |date=6 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} According to police, between 35,000 and 40,000 people attended the demonstration, while organizers estimated around 100,000 participants.{{cite web |url=http://www.jurnal.md/ro/politic/2015/9/6/a-inceput-marea-adunare-nationala-mii-de-oameni-protesteaza-in-centrul-chisinaului-fata-de-regimul-oligarhic/ |title=A început Marea Adunare Naţională; Mii de oameni protestează în centrul Chişinăului faţă de regimul oligarhic |work=Jurnal.md |date=6 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} The protest was the biggest since Moldova's independence movement in the early 1990s,{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/international/este-cea-mai-mare-adunare-nationala-de-la-independenta-r-moldova-zeci-de-mii-de-moldoveni-isi-cer-in-strada-tara-inapoi.html |title="Este cea mai mare adunare nationala de la independenta R. Moldova". Zeci de mii de moldoveni isi cer in strada tara inapoi |work=Stirile Pro TV |date=6 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} bigger even than the [[2009 Moldova civil unrest|mass anti-communist protests of April 2009]].{{cite web |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/09/06/uk-moldova-protests-idUKKCN0R60OV20150906 |title=Tens of thousands rally in Moldova against $1 billion bank fraud |last=Tanas |first=Alexander |date=6 September 2015}} Participants adopted a resolution demanding [[Moldovan parliamentary election, 2018|early elections]], the resignation of President [[Nicolae Timofti]] and all leading institutions of law, including the [[General Prosecutor’s Office of the Republic of Moldova|Prosecutor General]]'s office and the National Anticorruption Center. [[File:Vladimir Plahotniuc.png|thumb|left|200px|Targeted by protests, [[Vladimir Plahotniuc]], politician and influential businessman, fled the country after the 6 September demonstration.]] Clashes broke out with police at the prosecutor general's headquarters, where activists attempted to set up an [[occupy movement|occupy]]-style tent encampment. Opposition leaders have accused the prosecutor general of being an instrument of political persecution. Supporters of the radical left Red Bloc Party tried to break the police cordon and forcibly enter the prosecutor's office.{{cite web |url=http://www.romanialibera.ro/actualitate/international/chisinau--confruntari-violente-intre-manifestanti-si-politisti--mai-multe-persoane--ranite--391895?c=q2561 |title=Chișinău: Confruntări violente între manifestanți și polițiști. Mai multe persoane, RĂNITE |work=România Liberă |last=Dolana |first=Andra |date=6 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} Police detained seven activists,{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/zeci-de-mii-de-oameni-cer-la-chisinau-demisia-presedintelui-timofti-acuzat-ca-serve-te-interesele-oligarhilor_243073.html |title=Zeci de mii de oameni cer la Chişinău demisia preşedintelui Timofti, acuzat că serveşte interesele oligarhilor |work=România TV |last=Tudor |first=Iulian |date=6 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} including Antifa movement leader, Grigory Petrenko.{{cite web |url=http://www.iacenter.org/actions/petrenko/ |title=Free Grigory Petrenko and anti-oligarchy prisoners in Moldova! |work=International Action Center |date=9 September 2015}} A team from a local television station in Moldova was accosted by demonstrators.{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/violente-si-haos-la-chisinau-mii-de-oameni-in-strada-fortele-de-ordine-intervin-video_243056.html |title=VIOLENŢE şi HAOS la Chişinău. Mii de oameni în stradă, forţele de ordine au intervenit |work=România TV |last=Stan |first=Filip |date=6 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} Likewise, six policemen were injured and one woman was hospitalised. According to Interior Minister Oleg Balan, "their scope was to devastate the prosecutor's office".{{cite web |url=http://protv.md/stiri/actualitate/opt-persoane-retinute-dupa-protestul-de-la-procuratura-generala---1124891.html |title=Dupa altercatiile din fata Procuraturii Generale, politia a deschis 7 cauze penale pentru violenta asupra politistilor |work=Stirile Pro TV |date=7 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} Police removed tents in front of the prosecutor's office.{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/moldova/politica/update-chisinaul-iese-strada-reformarea-clasei-politice-1_55ebf750f5eaafab2c4f9ae7/index.html |title=Maidan la Chişinău: Confruntări soldate cu răniţi şi arestaţi după ce unii manifestanţi au încercat să părtrundă în clădiri publice |work=Adevărul |date=6 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} However, more than 90 tents were set up by protesters in Grand National Assembly Square, vowing to continue their protest until demands are met.{{cite web |url=http://www.jurnal.md/ro/social/2015/9/7/protestul-din-6-septembrie-continua-peste-90-de-corturi-instalate-in-oraselul-demnitatii-si-libertatii/ |title=Protestul din 6 septembrie continuă; Peste 90 de corturi, instalate în orăşelul "Demnităţii şi Libertăţii" |work=Jurnal.md |date=7 September 2015 |language=Romanian}}{{cite web |url=http://www.rferl.org/content/moldova-protests-bank-fraud/27229723.html |title=Moldovan Protest Leaders Set Up Tent City, Vow To Stay Until Demands Met |work=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty |date=7 September 2015}} Three Russian journalists from the pro-[[Kremlin]] television ''LifeNews'' were detained at [[Chișinău International Airport]]. They were forbidden to enter the Republic of Moldova.{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/international/europa/protest-foc-continuu-centrul-chisinaului-1_55eda6c1f5eaafab2c5b035d/index.html |title=Protest la foc continuu în centrul Chişinăului |work=Adevărul |date=7 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} The film crew intended to publicize the protests. Russian officials reacted to the arrest of three journalists. "Actions of the new leadership in Chișinău demonstrate their unwillingness to have constructive relations with Russia", stated Maria Zakharova, the official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry.{{cite web |url=http://www.timpul.md/articol/reactia-moscovei-in-cazul-jurnalistilor-rusi-retinuti-in-moldova-78907.html |title=Reacţia Moscovei în cazul jurnaliştilor ruşi reţinuţi în Moldova |work=Timpul.md |date=8 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} In the same context, Zakharova mentions that authorities' actions against Russian journalists "violate freedom of speech and access to information". Prime Minister [[Valeriu Streleț]] invited protest organisers to "talks", at the Ministry of Agriculture headquarters, but they announced they will not attend the meeting. A group of representatives of the Platform previously participated in a meeting with Streleț, at the Government headquarters, where they asked him to sign the list of claims, which was presented in the square. Amid the protests against the oligarchic regime, [[Vladimir Plahotniuc]] fled Moldova the same day for [[Geneva]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evzmd.md/actualitate/257-actualitate/27030-update-protest-organizatorii-anunta-cifra-participan%C8%9Bilor-andrei-nastase-plahotniuc-a-fugit-la-geneva.html |title=Angela Aramă: "Haideți să închidem Aeroportul". Grupul de contact al Platformei DA se îndreaptă spre sediul Guvernului, unde este așteptat de premierul Valeriu Streleț |work=Evenimentul Zilei |date=6 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} Concomitantly with the meeting, the [[Unité]] phone company, belonging state-owned [[Telephone company|telco]] [[Moldtelecom]], announced intentions to organise a free, open air concert, immediately criticised as an attempt to undermine the protest.{{cite web |url=http://www.agerpres.ro/externe/2015/09/06/ampla-manifestatie-antiguvernamentala-la-chisinau-vrem-tara-inapoi-scandeaza-mii-de-protestatari-14-53-30 |title=Amplă manifestație antiguvernamentală la Chișinău: "Vrem țara înapoi", scandează mii de protestatari |work=Agerpres |editor-last=Traci |editor-first=Liliana |date=6 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} Under the pressure of comments on social networks, many artists, starting with [[Ștefan Bănică, Jr.]], have declined participation, which could be interpreted as a political gesture. A week later, another major protest took place in [[Chișinău]],{{cite web |url=http://www.euronews.com/2015/09/13/large-rally-raises-pressure-on-moldovan-government-over-banking-scandal/ |title=Large rally raises pressure on Moldovan government over banking scandal |work=Euronews |date=13 September 2015}} attracting 20,000 people from all over Moldova.{{cite web |url=http://www.cotidianul.ro/un-nou-protest-la-chisinau-268017/ |title=Un nou miting de amploare la Chișinău |work=Cotidianul |last=Duțu |first=Constantin |date=13 September 2015 |language=Romanian}}{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/proteste-de-amploare-la-chisinau-zeci-de-mii-de-oameni-cer-demisia-presedintelui-si-a-guvernului_244376.html |title=Proteste de amploare la Chişinău. Zeci de mii de oameni cer demisia preşedintelui şi a guvernului |work=România TV |date=13 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} Clashes between supporters of the ''Dignity and Justice'' civic platform and a group advocating Moldova's unification with Romania broke out soon after the rally began.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-34237078 |title=Moldova: Huge anti-corruption protest in Chisinau |work=BBC News |date=13 September 2015}} The city centre has been cordoned off and many law enforcers were deployed on the streets. A resolution was adopted at the end of the demonstration, in which protesters call for a [[general strike]] and formation of a political movement and a so-called government of popular trust.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/international/republica-moldova-ar-putea-fi-paralizata-de-o-greva-generala-14711248 |title=Republica Moldova ar putea fi paralizată de o grevă generală |work=Gândul |date=14 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} On 29 November, another protest organized by DA Platform took place in the Grand National Assembly Square. Demonstrators and supporters of the platform have expressed dissatisfaction with the political and economic situation in the country and called for early elections.{{cite web |url=http://www.timpul.md/articol/%28live%29-protest-in-pman--protestatarii-cer-demisia-guvernarii--piaa-este-inconjurata-de-poliie--canta-piese-de-a-soilor-aldea-teodorovici-83728.html |title=PROTEST în PMAN. Protestatarii cer demisia guvernării. Piața este înconjurată de poliție. Cântă piese de-a soților Aldea Teodorovici |work=Timpul.md |date=29 November 2015}} To ensure security, hundreds of police formed two cordons in front of the Government. During the protest, DA Platform representatives said they will create a political party.{{cite web |url=http://www.publika.md/un-nou-protest-organizat-de-platforma-da-manifestantii-cer-demisia-guvernarii-foto_2461011.html |title=UN NOU PROTEST organizat de Platforma DA. Manifestanţii cer demisia guvernării |work=Publika.md |date=29 November 2015}} Protests also took place in [[Bălți]], [[Orhei]], [[Cahul]], [[Hîncești]], [[Ungheni]] and [[Soroca]]. {{Gallery |title=Founding members of the Civic Platform ''Dignity and Truth'' |width=160 | height=170 |align=center |File:Andrei Năstase (2015-09-08).png |Andrei Năstase |File:Vasile Năstase (2015-09-11).png |Vasile Năstase |File:Valentin Dolganiuc (2015-09-04).png |Valentin Dolganiuc }} === Political crisis === [[File:MD.C.Chișinău - Protest Platforma „Demnitate și Adevăr” (people) - jan 16, 2016.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Protests in the wake of 2016 political crisis]] On 13 January 2016, 56 deputies of the parliamentary coalition formed around PD proposed controversial businessman [[Vlad Plahotniuc]] for the position of prime minister. The proposal was immediately rejected by President [[Nicolae Timofti]], invoking integrity reasons.{{cite web |url=http://www.digi24.ro/Stiri/Digi24/Extern/Europa/O+noua+zi+tensionata+la+Chisinau |title=Chișinău. Președintele Nicolae Timofti a desemnat un nou premier |work=Digi24 |date=14 January 2016}} Timofti asked coalition representatives to propose another name until 14 January at 12 a.m.{{cite web |url=http://www.capital.ro/dw-moldova-in-pragul-revolutiei-totul-depinde-de-o-decizie-a-presedintelui.html |title=DW: Moldova, în pragul revoluției! Totul depinde de o decizie a președintelui |work=Capital |date=14 January 2016}} In the evening of 13 January, the coalition announced that will propose again Plahotniuc, thus escalating the constitutional conflict.{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/international/zi-decisiva-in-moldova-vlad-plahotniuc-e-propus-a-doua-oara-premier-desi-presedintele-timofti-a-refuzat-numirea-lui.html |title=Criza in R. Moldova. Ion Paduraru, desemnat pentru functia de premier. De ce a respins presedintele varianta Plahotniuc |work=Stirile Pro TV |date=14 January 2015}} The same day, two rallies took place in Chișinău, one that supports Vlad Plahotniuc for the position of prime minister and another that opposes the nomination. Next day, protests continued, with tens of thousands of people demonstrating in central Chișinău against Plahotniuc.{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/moldova-thousands-protest-proposed-pm-candidate-36281945 |title=Moldova: Thousands Protest Against Proposed PM Candidate |work=ABC News |author=Corneliu Rusnac |date=14 January 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://www.rferl.org/content/moldova-protests-plahotniuc/27488410.html |title=Moldovan President Moves To End Political Crisis |work=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty |date=14 January 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://tass.ru/en/world/849660 |title=Moldova opposition protests against Plahotniuc nomination for prime minister |work=TASS |date=14 January 2016}} By night, Timofti nominated the Secretary General of the Presidency, Ion Păduraru, candidate for this position,{{cite web |url=http://www.hotnews.ro/stiri-esential-20726820-livetext-decisiva-moldova-oligarhul-plahotniuc-propus-doua-oara-premier-chisinaul-fierbe-trei-mitinguri-paralel.htm |title=Thriller politic in Moldova: Presedintele Nicolae Timofti l-a sfidat pe Vlad Plahotniuc si l-a desemnat drept premier pe Ion Paduraru, seful cancelarei sale |work=HotNews.ro |date=14 January 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/externe/ion-paduraru-desemnat-premier-al-republicii-moldova-14965938 |title=Ion Păduraru, desemnat premier al Republicii Moldova |work=Mediafax |author=Mihai Draghici |date=14 January 2016}} defying PD's proposal. However, Ion Păduraru announced his withdrawal from the race in less than 24 hours after the announcement of his nomination. He justified his gesture by the fact that the parliamentary majority has already nominated another proposal of premier, and President Timofti will consider it as a compromise solution. On 16 January, the parliamentary coalition grouped around the Democratic Party of Vlad Plahotniuc announced that disagrees with the proposal of President Timofti and came up with a new proposal for premier, instead of Plahotniuc – [[Pavel Filip]]. Later that day, up to 20,000 people joined three different rallies that were organized by both the left [[Socialist Party of Moldova]] and the centre-right Civic Platform DA.{{cite web |url=https://www.rt.com/news/329210-tens-thousands-protest-moldova/ |title=Tens of thousands protest in Moldova calling for snap elections |work=RT |date=16 January 2016}} The protesters called on the Moldovan president and chief prosecutor to resign, demanding early elections and prompt measures against corruption. They also opposed the nomination of Pavel Filip to the post of Prime Minister. On 20 January, a majority of 57 MPs voted in favor of PD-backed Pavel Filip Government. During the parliamentary meeting, the Parliament building was surrounded by about 1,000 protesters that demanded the interruption of the vote.{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/international/parlamentul-din-r-moldova-voteaza-astazi-echipa-guvernamentala-a-premierului-desemnat-pavel-filip-lista-ministrilor.html |title=Proteste violente la Chisinau. Multimea a luat cu asalt Parlamentul, alesii au fost evacuati printr-o iesire secreta |work=Stirile Pro TV |date=20 January 2016}} They broke a side door of the Parliament and entered the building,{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/europa/moldova/proteste-la-chisinau-live-1405143 |title=Haos la Chisinau - Guvern investit in secret, la miez de noapte |work=Ziare.com |author=Diana Robu, Ana Ilie |date=20 January 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3408774/Hundreds-protesters-storm-Moldovan-parliament-country-appoints-prime-minister-year.html |title=Hundreds of protesters storm Moldovan parliament in anger after country appoints third prime minister in less than a year |work=Daily Mail |author=Imogen Calderwood |date=20 January 2016}}{{cite web |url=https://www.rt.com/news/329590-protesters-storm-moldova-parliament/ |title=Protesters in Moldovan capital storm parliament building |work=RT |date=20 January 2016}} forcing the cordon of gendarmes. Many gendarmes offered no resistance, being dragged out of the device and giving up shields and batons.{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/moldova/actualitate/live-vot-nou-guvern-chisinau-protestatarii-ameninta-intra-parlament-1_569f80bd37115986c6b6db64/index.html |title=Preşedintele Timofti a amânat ceremonia de depunere a jurământului pentru Guvernul Filip după ce protestatarii au luat cu asalt Parlamentul |work=Adevărul |date=20 January 2016}} After several hours, police intervened in force, removing the protesters from the Parliament and cordoning the building off. 15 people, six protesters and nine gendarmes,{{cite web |url=http://unimedia.info/stiri/In-urma-protestelor-de-ieri-seara-15-persoane-au-ajuns-la-spitalul-de-urgenta-108100.html |title=În urma protestelor de ieri seara 15 persoane au ajuns la Spitalul de Urgență |work=Unimedia |date=21 January 2016}} suffered contusions after confrontations at Parliament. One of them was President of the [[Liberal Party (Moldova)|Liberal Party]], [[Mihai Ghimpu]], who had his head broken, being hit by protesters while leaving the Parliament.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/international/criza-la-chisinau-proteste-violente-dupa-votul-in-favoarea-guvernului-pavel-filip-manifestantii-au-intrat-cu-forta-in-parlament-live-video-14973448 |title=CRIZĂ LA CHIŞINĂU. Proteste violente după votul în favoarea Guvernului Pavel Filip. Manifestanţii au intrat cu forţa în Parlament |work=Gândul |author=Andrei Luca Popescu |date=20 January 2016}} === Renewed protests === Thousands of people calling for Moldova's reunification with Romania took to the streets of Chișinău on 27 March in a so-called "march of reunion". The rally organizers say some 50,000 people took part in the protests{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/stiri/mars-de-amploare-in-chisinau-pentru-unirea-cu-romania-15158121 |title=Marş de amploare în Chişinău, pentru unirea cu România |work=Gândul |author=Roxana Măciucă |date=27 March 2016}} while police put the number at 5,000–6,000 people.{{cite web |url=http://www.rferl.org/content/moldova-rally-romania-unification/27638163.html |title=Thousands In Moldova Rally For Unification With Romania |work=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty |date=27 March 2016}} The rally was meant to mark the 98th anniversary since [[Bessarabia]] was unified with the [[Kingdom of Romania]] on 27 March 1918. A bomb alert was triggered at Nicolae Sulac National Palace, during the formation of platform ''Sfatul Țării 2'', that brings together the unionist organizations in Moldova fighting for the unification with Romania. Sappers and firefighters were deployed on the spot, but found that the alarm was false.{{cite web |url=http://www.mediafax.ro/externe/alerta-cu-bomba-la-chisinau-in-timpul-constituirii-platformei-care-reuneste-organizatiile-unioniste-15157841 |title=Alertă cu bombă la Chişinău în timpul constituirii platformei care reuneşte organizaţiile unioniste |work=Mediafax |author=Roxana Măciucă |date=27 March 2016}} Representatives of Voievod Movement held a counter manifestation. They were surrounded by law enforcers in order to avoid the degeneration of the situation.{{cite web |url=http://unimedia.info/stiri/video-contramanifestatie-si-altercatii-la-marsul-unionistilor-din-centrul-capitalei-112015.html |title=Contramanifestație și altercații la Marșul unioniștilor din centrul capitalei |work=Unimedia |date=27 March 2016}} ====2017==== On 11 June 2017 a new protest took place at Chișinău: around 4.000 citizens took part at a protest against adopting a law of mixed voting system, promoted by the [[Democratic Party of Moldova]], seen by the [[Venice Commission]] and European rights experts as inappropriate for Moldova.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-moldova-election-protests/in-moldova-thousands-protest-over-proposed-voting-changes-idUSKBN1920UV|title=In Moldova, thousands protest over proposed voting changes|date=11 June 2017|via=Reuters}}
{{cite web|url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/international/proteste-in-r-moldova-24-000-de-oameni-au-iesit-in-strada-pentru-a-se-opune-unui-proiect-de-reforma-a-sistemului-electoral.html|title=Proteste in R. Moldova. 24.000 de oameni au iesit in strada pentru a se opune unui proiect de reforma a sistemului electoral|language=Romanian}}
{{cite web|url=http://www.timpul.md/articol/live-protest-la-chiinau-impotriva-schimbarii-sistemului-electoral-110727.html|title=LIVE: Protest la Chișinău împotriva schimbării sistemului electoral|language=Romanian}}
{{cite web|url=http://agora.md/gallery/163|title=11.06.2017 Protestul societății civile din fața Parlamentului|website=AGORA|language=Romanian}}
{{cite web|url=http://www.gds.ro/Actualitate/2017-06-11/manifestatie-de-protest-la-chisinau-impotriva-modificarii-sistemului-electoral/|title=Manifestație de protest la Chișinău împotriva modificării sistemului electoral|language=Romanian}}
{{cite web|url=http://www.moldova.org/en/reuters-venice-commission-finds-moldovas-electoral-system-change-inappropriate/|title=Reuters: Venice Commission finds Moldova's electoral system change "inappropriate" - Moldova.org|first=Cristi|last=Vlas|date=6 June 2017|accessdate=17 September 2017}} On 17 September 2017 a new protest took place: the protesters have manifested again against the mixed voting system.{{cite web|url=http://jurnal.md/ro/politic/2017/9/17/consiliul-marii-adunari-nationale-organizeaza-un-nou-protest-de-amploare-la-chisinau/|title=Consiliul Marii Adunări Naţionale organizează un nou PROTEST de amploare la Chişinău|language=Romanian|accessdate=17 September 2017}}
{{cite web|url=https://www.timpul.md/articol/aciune-de-protest-pentru-a-cere-anularea-modificarii-actualului-sistem-electoral-119430.html|title=Un protest împotriva modificării sistemului electoral a avut loc în capitală|language=Romanian|accessdate=17 September 2017}}
{{cite web|url=http://tribuna.md/2017/09/17/protest-in-fata-parlamentului-sa-maturam-aceasta-guvernare/|title=Protest în fața Parlamentului: Să măturam această guvernare|publisher=|accessdate=17 September 2017}}
{{cite web|url=http://www.moldova.org/protest-in-fata-parlamentului-impotriva-modificarii-sistemului-electoral-video/|title=Protest în faţa Parlamentului împotriva modificării sistemului electoral// VIDEO — Moldova.org|first=Diana|last=Preașcă|date=17 September 2017|language=Romanian|accessdate=17 September 2017}}
{{cite web|url=http://romanialibera.ro/actualitate/international/chisinau---protest-contra-modificarii-sistemului-electoral-469272|title=Chişinău - protest contra modificării sistemului electoral - Romania Libera|website=RomaniaLibera.ro|accessdate=17 September 2017|language=Romanian}} == Aftermath == [[File:EPP Summit, 14 Mar. 2013 (8556356321).jpg|thumb|200px|Former PM and leader of PLDM, [[Vlad Filat]], was arrested on 15 October for involvement in the [[$1 billion bank fraud]].]] Former prime minister [[Vlad Filat]], leader of the [[Liberal Democratic Party of Moldova]], was detained in parliament on 15 October over the theft of $1 billion from the banking system.{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/10/15/us-moldova-protests-filat-idUSKCN0S91BY20151015 |title=Moldova detains former PM in parliament over $1 billion fraud |work=Reuters |last=Tanas |first=Alexander |date=15 October 2015}}{{cite web |url=http://www.voanews.com/content/moldova-former-prime-minister-filat-arrested-bank-fraud/3009275.html |title=Moldova's Ex-PM Arrested for Alleged Bank Fraud |work=VOA News |date=15 October 2015}} Masked officers entered the Moldovan parliament to handcuff and arrest Filat, while anti-government protesters had blocked the exits to the building for most of the day to prevent him leaving. Moments earlier, the lawmakers voted to strip Filat of his [[parliamentary immunity]].{{cite web |url=http://www.rferl.org/content/moldova-ex-pm-immunity-lifted-fraud-probe/27308192.html |title=Moldova's Ex-PM Detained After Parliament Lifts His Immunity |work=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty |date=15 October 2015}} Vlad Filat is accused of passive [[corruption]] and [[influence peddling]]. He would preted [[bribe]] €250 million from Ilan Shor to determine legislative decisions to diminish the position of the Moldovan state in the Savings Bank.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/international/fostul-premier-al-moldovei-retinut-pentru-coruptie-vlad-filat-e-acuzat-ca-ar-fi-cerut-mita-250-de-milioane-de-euro-14845516 |title=Fostul premier al Moldovei, reţinut pentru corupţie. Vlad Filat e acuzat că ar fi cerut mită 250 de milioane de euro |work=Gândul |last=Bojan |first=Ioana |date=15 October 2015 |language=Romanian}} [[Ilan Shor]], Mayor of [[Orhei]], is also accused in the "Robbery of the century" corruption case, as the media named the $1 billion bank fraud. On 16 October, the [[National Bank of Moldova]] has withdrawn the licenses of financial activity for Savings Bank, Social Bank and Unibank. Thus has begun the process of liquidation thereof.{{cite web |url=http://www.publika.md/ultima-suflare-bnm-retrage-licentele-bancii-de-economii-bancii-sociale-si-ale-unibank_2425451.html |title=Ultima suflare! BNM retrage licenţele Băncii de Economii, Băncii Sociale şi ale Unibank |work=Publika.md |date=16 October 2015 |language=Romanian}} On 29 October, three months after formation, the Streleț government was dismissed through a [[motion of censure]], voted in favour by 65 MPs.{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/international/guvernul-proeuropean-al-republicii-moldova-a-fost-demis-dupa-doar-3-luni-de-activitate-printr-o-motiune-de-cenzura-a-stangii-14866636 |title=Guvernul proeuropean al Republicii Moldova a fost demis după doar 3 luni de activitate, printr-o moţiune de cenzură a stângii |work=Gândul |last=Popescu |first=Andrei Luca |date=29 October 2015 |language=Romanian}} The government's dismissal was enacted through the votes of the Socialist, Communist, and Democratic Party deputies.{{cite web |url=http://unimedia.info/stiri/video-ultima-ora-guvernul-strelet-a-primit-vot-de-neincredere--ce-urmeaza-103487.html |title=Ultimă oră! Guvernul Streleț a primit vot de neîncredere. Ce urmează |work=Unimedia |last=Zavadovschi |first=Silvia |date=29 October 2015 |language=Romanian}}{{cite web |url=http://www.timpul.md/articol/stanga-romanofoba-i-anti-europeana-a-demis-guvernul--pdm-psrm-i-pcrm-au-votat-impreuna-impotriva-guvernului-strele-81744.html |title=Stânga românofobă și anti-europeană a demis Guvernul. PDM, PSRM și PCRM au votat ÎMPREUNĂ împotriva Guvernului Streleț |work=Timpul.md |date=29 October 2015 |language=Romanian}}{{cite web |url=http://www.publika.md/moldova-fara-executiv-parlamentul-a-votat-pentru-demiterea-guvernului-strelet_2435551.html |title=MOLDOVA, FĂRĂ EXECUTIV! Parlamentul a votat pentru DEMITEREA GUVERNULUI STRELEŢ |work=Publika.md |date=29 October 2015 |language=Romanian}} The stated reason underlying the motion was "suspicion of the corruption of Prime Minister Valeriu Streleț". Soon after the vote, the Romanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs reacted, saying that stability of government should be allowed to prevail and the pro-European mandate given in the results of the November 2014 elections should be executed.{{cite web |url=http://www.mae.ro/node/34393 |title=MAE a luat notă de votul privind moțiunea de cenzură împotriva Guvernului Republicii Moldova |work=Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date=29 October 2015 |language=Romanian}} == Reactions == === Domestic === [[Igor Dodon]], leader of the country's largest opposition party, the influential [[Moscow]]-friendly [[Party of Socialists of the Republic of Moldova|Socialist Party]], has denounced the government's silence toward what he described as "officials and representatives of right-wing extremist, nationalist and "neo-Nazi" groups from Romania who attended the 5 July gathering. After a first meeting with the leaders of the protesters, Moldovan PM [[Valeriu Streleț]] stated that his government would resign only in case of a [[Motion of no confidence|no-confidence vote]] in Parliament.{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/proteste-la-chisinau-guvernul-demisioneaza-numai-in-cazul-unui-vot-de-neincredere-dat-de-parlament_243898.html |title=Proteste la Chişinău: Guvernul demisionează numai în cazul unui vot de neîncredere dat de Parlament |work=omânia TV |date=10 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} In a message published on the Presidency page, [[Nicolae Timofti]] cataloged the 6 September demonstration as a democratic exercise. As for his resignation, Timofti said he won't resign because "such a decision would bring instability to the Republic of Moldova".{{cite web |url=http://moldova24.info/2015/09/reactia-lui-timofti-in-legatura-cu-protestele-din-tara-nu-voi-demisiona/ |title=REACȚIA lui Timofti în legătură cu protestele din țară: Nu voi demisiona |work=Moldova24 |date=9 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} According to [[Dorin Chirtoacă]], Mayor of Chișinău, pressure from society must exist, but organizers of protests should correctly calculate their forces and actions. He also stated that eventual early elections would further destabilize the situation in Moldova.{{cite web |url=https://trm.md/ro/politic/chirtoaca-anticipatele-ar-destabiliza-situatia-din-republica-moldova/ |title=Chirtoacă: Anticipatele ar destabiliza situaţia din Republica Moldova |work=TeleRadio Moldova |date=14 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} A similar position was adopted by Moldova's parliament speaker, [[Andrian Candu]], saying such a move would leave the country stuck in economic crisis.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-34242511 |title=Early Moldova elections 'would be catastrophic' |work=BBC News |date=14 September 2015}} During the September protests, Dorin Chirtoacă has called for the tents to be removed from the central boulevard and claimed that not only is the protest illegal, but that it is being fomented by [[Moscow]].{{cite web |url=http://www.unian.info/world/1150999-chisinaus-mayor-accuses-russian-security-officials-of-orchestrating-protests-in-moldova.html |title=Chisinau's Mayor accuses Russian security officials of orchestrating protests in Moldova |work=UNIAN |date=13 October 2015}} He has claimed that Renato Usatîi and [[Igor Dodon]] are puppets of [[Vladimir Putin]]. === International === ====Official reactions==== =====Supranational organisations===== * In response to the [[$1 billion bank fraud]], the [[EU]], [[International Monetary Fund]] and [[World Bank]] have frozen their financial assistance to Moldova.[https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-34244341 Moldova anger grows over banking scandal], [[BBC News]] (14 September 2015) * {{flagicon|United Nations}} [[UN High Commissioner for Human Rights]], [[Prince Zeid bin Ra'ad|Zeid Ra'ad Al-Hussein]], has called on authorities in Moldova to address the demands of protesters,{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/international/onu-solicita-autoritatilor-din-republica-moldova-sa-raspunda-protestatarilor-14712119 |title=ONU solicită autorităţilor din Republica Moldova să răspundă protestatarilor |work=Gândul |last=Măciucă |first=Roxana |date=14 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} warning that a failure to do so "could lead to greater polarization of society".{{cite web |url=http://www.rferl.org/content/un-rights-chief-moldova-/27246521.html |title=UN Rights Chief Urges Moldova To Address Protesters' Demands |work=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty |date=14 September 2015}} =====States===== * {{flagicon|Romania}} Romanian Prime Minister [[Victor Ponta]] expressed his concern about the situation in Moldova, that, in his opinion, is "worse than last year", but says that he supports his counterpart in Chișinău and Moldova's European course.{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/victor-ponta/premier/ponta-ingrijorat-de-protestele-din-moldova-sa-nu-ne-trezim-cu-primari-prorusi-la-chisinau-si-balti-1361448 |title=Ponta, ingrijorat de protestele din Moldova: Sa nu ne trezim cu primari prorusi la Chisinau si Balti |work=Ziare.com |date=4 May 2015 |language=Romanian}} Ponta is a vocal supporter of Romania's reunification. In September 2014, he gave a speech at [[Alba Iulia]], stating that "my commitment is to jointly make a second Great Union of Romania".{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/stiri/reactia-rusiei-dupa-afirmatiile-lui-victor-ponta-privind-unirea-cu-republica-moldova-13279877 |title=Reacţia Rusiei după afirmaţiile lui Victor Ponta privind unirea cu Republica Moldova |work=Gândul |last=Drăghici |first=Mihai |date=16 September 2014 |language=Romanian}} During a meeting of the Presidents of Romania and Moldova in [[Suceava]],{{cite web |url=https://news.yahoo.com/moldovan-romanian-presidents-support-moldova-joining-eu-131016170.html |title=Moldovan, Romanian presidents support Moldova joining EU |work=Yahoo! News |date=7 July 2015}} [[Klaus Iohannis]] stated that "people on both sides of the Prut" will be found in one day not only in the [[EU]], but also "in communion", adding that "we will be there for Moldovan citizens no matter how much effort we have to exert and how much will last".{{cite web |url=http://www.gandul.info/politica/iohannis-oamenii-de-pe-cele-doua-maluri-ale-prutului-se-vor-regasi-intr-o-buna-zi-nu-doar-in-uniune-ci-si-in-comuniune-14556918 |title=Iohannis: Oamenii de pe cele două maluri ale Prutului se vor regăsi într-o bună zi nu doar în Uniune, ci şi în comuniune |work=Gândul |last=Andrei |first=Cristian |date=7 July 2015 |language=Romanian}} :On 26 January 2016, the [[Government of Romania]] offered a €60 million loan to help stave off economic collapse. To get the money, Prime Minister [[Dacian Cioloș]] said Moldova will have to reform its justice system, fight corruption, sign a draft agreement for a loan from the [[International Monetary Fund]] and appoint a new central bank governor.{{cite web |url=http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/E/EU_ROMANIA_MOLDOVA?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT |title=Romania offers Moldova $65 million loan to spur reforms |work=AP |author=Alison Mutler |date=26 January 2016}} * {{flagicon|United States}} According to the [[United States]] Embassy in Chișinău, protests highlight the frustration experienced by many Moldovans due to lack of reforms in their country.{{cite web |url=http://unimedia.info/stiri/Reacia-Ambasadei-Statelor-Unite-la-Chiinau-privind-protestele-din-PMAN-100736.html |title=Reacția Ambasadei Statelor Unite la Chișinău privind protestele din PMAN |work=Unimedia |date=10 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} American diplomats support the right of citizens to protest peacefully, urging Moldova's Government to quickly implement the necessary reforms, such as expanding anti-corruption efforts. ====Others==== * {{flagicon|United States}} According to [[Stratfor]], protests could threaten the stability of Moldova's fragile government. Consequently, the possible weakening or collapse of the Moldovan government "could slow Moldova's European integration".{{Cite web|url = https://www.stratfor.com/analysis/protests-threaten-moldovas-fragile-government|title = Protests Threaten Moldova's Fragile Government|date = 15 May 2015|accessdate = |website = Stratfor|publisher = |last = |first = }} A similar analysis from Stratfor shows that "the recent rallies and the positive reaction from top Romanian officials are signs of increasing Romanian influence in Moldova".{{cite web |url=https://www.stratfor.com/analysis/moldovas-instability-could-be-romanias-opportunity |title=Moldova's Instability Could Be Romania's Opportunity |work=Stratfor |date=17 July 2015}} * {{flagicon|Georgia}}/{{flagicon|Ukraine}} Former Georgian President [[Mikheil Saakashvili]], now Governor of Ukrainian [[Odessa Oblast]], considers that protests taking place in Chișinău are "an anti-oligarchic movement which answers Ukraine's aspirations".{{cite web |url=http://independent.md/saakasvili-despre-protestele-de-la-chisinau-oamenii-au-obosit-de-coruptie-si-clanuri-oligarhice/#.VfZYQX2LWA5 |title=Saakașvili, despre protestele de la Chișinău: "Oamenii au obosit de corupție și clanuri oligarhice" |work=Independent.md |date=7 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} "It is known that, in recent years, Moldovan oligarchs began to control everything. They control all state bodies, most of the Parliament and almost entirely the premier. When former prime minister [Chiril Gaburici] tried to change something, was immediately put on the table a file with compromising materials. This is a typical oligarchic style", concluded Saakashvili.{{cite web |url=http://www.cotidianul.ro/saakasvili-isi-da-cu-parerea-despre-protestele-de-la-chisinau-267687/ |title=Saakaşvili îşi dă cu părerea despre protestele de la Chişinău |work=Cotidianul |date=7 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} Likewise, Saakashvili deems "the people come out on street to protest against oligarchs, but not in the favor of Russia. I think that the whole population of the Republic of Moldova is for Europe, and among youth it is an absolute majority". * {{flagicon|Russia}} In an article published by the news agency [[RIA Novosti]], President of the Center for Systematic Analysis and Forecasting in [[Moscow]], Rostislav Ishchenko, says that events in the Republic of Moldova remind of the [[Orange Revolution|"orange" scenario]]. According to the author, all [[Color revolutions|"colored" coups]] were organized and guided by the [[United States]], and the embassies were coordination centres for protesters, scenario also "applied" in Moldova.{{cite web |url=http://independent.md/presa-rusa-protestele-de-la-chisinau-sunt-dirijate-de-sua/#.VfZbkn2LWA4 |title=Presa rusă: Protestele de la Chișinău sunt dirijate de SUA |work=Independent.md |date=12 September 2015 |language=Romanian}} Moreover, Russian analyst writes that "rumors that make connections between protesters and EU, particularly [[Germany]], country from where would be financed the DJ Platform, are identical to those linking the [[Euromaidan|protests in Kiev]] and financiers in Germany".{{cite web |url=http://ria.ru/analytics/20150910/1241698462.html#ixzz3lQNd37Md |title=Ситуация в Молдове и выбор США |work=RIA Novosti |date=10 September 2015 |language=Russian}} == See also == {{Portal|Moldova|Social movements}} * [[April 2009 Moldovan parliamentary election protests]] * [[2013 "Pro Europe" demonstration in Moldova]] == References == {{Reflist|3}} ==External links== {{Commons category|2015 Moldovan protests}} *[http://southfront.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/M2.jpg?COLLCC=396596210& Infographics depicting anti-oligarch protests in Moldova] {{Anti-government protests in the 21st century}} {{DEFAULTSORT:2015-16 protests in Moldova}} [[Category:2015 in Moldova]] [[Category:2015 protests]] [[Category:2016 in Moldova]] [[Category:2016 protests]] [[Category:History of Chișinău]] [[Category:Moldova–European Union relations]] [[Category:Pro-Europeanism]] [[Category:Protests in Moldova]]

{{Infobox U.S. legislation | shorttitle = Bankhead-Jones Act of 1935 | othershorttitles = Agricultural Research Act | longtitle = An Act to provide for research into basic laws and principles relating to agriculture and to provide for the further development of cooperative agricultural extension work and the more complete endowment and support of land-grant colleges. | colloquialacronym = | nickname = | enacted by = 74th | effective date = | public law url = | cite public law = 74-182 | cite statutes at large = {{usstat|49|436}} | acts amended = | acts repealed = | title amended = [[Title 7 of the United States Code|7 U.S.C.: Agriculture]] | sections created = {{Usc-title-chap|7|17}} § 427 | sections amended = | leghisturl = | introducedin = <!--House or Senate--> | introducedbill = | introducedby = <!--sponsor(s)--> | introduceddate = | committees = | passedbody1 = | passeddate1 = | passedvote1 = | passedbody2 = | passedas2 = <!-- used if the second body changes the name of the legislation --> | passeddate2 = | passedvote2 = | conferencedate = | passedbody3 = | passeddate3 = | passedvote3 = | agreedbody3 = <!-- used when the other body agrees without going into committee --> | agreeddate3 = <!-- used when the other body agrees without going into committee --> | agreedvote3 = <!-- used when the other body agrees without going into committee --> | agreedbody4 = <!-- used if agreedbody3 further amends legislation --> | agreeddate4 = <!-- used if agreedbody3 further amends legislation --> | agreedvote4 = <!-- used if agreedbody3 further amends legislation --> | passedbody4 = | passeddate4 = | passedvote4 = | signedpresident = [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] | signeddate = June 29, 1935 | unsignedpresident = <!-- used when passed without presidential signing --> | unsigneddate = <!-- used when passed without presidential signing --> | vetoedpresident = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | vetoeddate = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddenbody1 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddendate1 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddenvote1 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddenbody2 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddendate2 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddenvote2 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | amendments = | SCOTUS cases = }} The '''Bankhead-Jones Act''' was enacted on June 29, 1935 during the [[The Great Depression|Depression]], to provide increased [[federal funding]] to [[land grant college]]s. Under the law as was last increased in 1972, $8,100,000 per year is divided equally between all [[United States|states]], and another $4,360,000 is divided between the states based upon each state's population.<ref>7 U.S.C. §427</ref> These federal funds are subject to matching by the states.
==External links== * [http://www.ifas.ufl.edu/land_grant_history/bankhead.html Text of statute]
==References== <references/> {{US farm acts}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bankhead-Jones Act of 1935}} [[Category:1935 in law]] [[Category:74th United States Congress]] [[Category:Land-grant universities and colleges|*]] [[Category:History of United States colleges and universities]] [[Category:United States federal agriculture legislation]] [[Category:United States federal public land legislation]]

The '''Chief Veterinary Officer''' of Hungary, as a [[Chief Veterinary Officer|chief veterinary officer]], is the supervisor of the [[National Food Chain Safety Office]], and in general, the governmental veterinary services including [[animal health]], [[animal rights|animal protection]] and welfare and food chain safety control. Besides organizing and operating [[veterinary public health]], he plays a significant role in international agricultural and trade affairs, in which the animal health and [[food safety]] status usually an important issue. His responsibilities are detailed in the law XLVI of 2008 on food chain and its authority control.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://net.jogtar.hu/jr/gen/hjegy_doc.cgi?docid=a0800046.tv|title=2008. évi XLVI. törvény - az élelmiszerláncról és hatósági felügyeletéről|last=Kft.|first=Wolters Kluwer|access-date=2017-10-17|language=en}}</ref>
== List == This is a list of the chief veterinary officers of Hungary in chronological order:
* 1945-1948: Dr. Kolgyári László * 1948-1953: Dr. Kádár Tibor * 1953-1953: Dr. Láng Miklós * 1953-1963: Dr. Pusztai Oszkár * 1963-1973: Dr. Kádár Tibor * 1973-1978: Dr. Dénes Lajos * 1978-1990: Dr. Glózik András * 1990-1992: Dr. Simor Ferenc * 1992-1995: Dr. Nagy Attila * 1995-1996: Dr. Fehérvári Tamás * 1996-2000: Dr. Bálint Tibor * 2000-2002: Dr. Németh Antal * 2002-2005: Dr. Bálint Tibor * 2005-2010: Dr. Süth Miklós * 2010-2014: Dr. Kardeván Endre * 2014- : Dr. Bognár Lajos
== References == <references />

revision.text:
'''DontGo''' (also commonly spelled in numerous other ways such as '''Don't Go''', '''DontGO''', and '''Don'tGO''') is a [[free market]] [[political activist]] [[non-profit organization|non-profit group]] founded by [[American conservative]] [[Patrick Ruffini]], who had previously created the [[blog]] ''The Next Right'', and [[libertarianism|libertarian]] Eric Odom, an [[marketer|internet marketer]] living in [[Chicago, Illinois]].<ref name=TV>[http://www.pjtv.com/?cmd=page&page-id=167 The Tea Party Coalition Show]. [[Pajamas TV]]. Accessed April 14, 2009.</ref><ref name=cnn/>
==History== The group started during the August 2008 [[United States offshore drilling debate|offshore oil drilling debate]] in the [[United States House|House of Representatives]], their members strongly favored further drilling and supported the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] revolt on the issue. Founders Odom and Ruffini intended for their website to work as a [[wikt:clearing house|clearinghouse]] of information for the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republicans]].<ref name=cnn>[http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2008/08/05/conservative-online-activists-launch-dont-go-web-site/ Conservative online activists launch '#dont Go' Web site]. By Martina Stewart. [[CNN.com]] Published August 5, 2008.</ref><ref name=who/> The name came from conservatives who had asked the [[United States House|House]] not to shut down for their annual summer break in 2008.<ref name=TV/> Critics of the group accused it of taking contributions from [[Big Oil|oil companies]]. Eric Odom strongly disputes the charges, saying that he's "still waiting on those magical checks".<ref>[http://www.dontgomovement.com/blog/2009/04/10/is-the-tea-party-tied-to-the-gop/ Is the Tea Party tied to the GOP?] By Eric Odom. [http://www.dontgomovement.com/blog/ DontGo Blog]. Posted April 10, 2009.</ref>
Eric Odom has stated that "Our agenda is to declare war on incumbency and long term power.<ref name=who/> The group's mission statement on its website labels it "for anyone who supports free markets, low-taxes, low-regulation and personal freedoms."<ref name=ob>[http://www.dontgomovement.com/objective/ Objective]. [http://www.dontgomovement.com/ dontgomovement.com] Accessed April 14, 2009.</ref> Three national conservative groups, DontGo, [[FreedomWorks]], and [[Americans for Prosperity]] led the tea party movement in April, 2009, according to ''[[The Atlantic]]'' magazine, which referred to DontGo as a "tech savvy" "online rapid response team".<ref name=who/>
==Projects== The group is instrumental in co-coordinating the [[Nationwide Chicago Tea Party]], which led to the [[Tax Day Tea Party]] protests. It claims to have worked with 700 separate demonstrations. Odom, a [[Bob Barr]] supporter with [[libertarianism|libertarian leanings]], opposes too much [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] involvement with their protests. Notably, he turned down a request from [[Republican National Committee]] Chairman [[Michael Steele]] to speak at the group's Chicago protest.<ref name=who>[https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2009/04/the-tea-party-movement-whos-in-charge/13041/ The Tea Party Movement: Who's In Charge?] By Chris Good. ''[[Atlantic Monthly]]''. Posted April 13, 2009.</ref> After the snub, the [[Republican National Committee]] released a statement saying that "They're just having a little fun."<ref>[https://www.usnews.com/blogs/washington-whispers/2009/4/10/gop-chairman-michael-steele-denies-tea-party-claim.html GOP Chairman Michael Steele Denies Tea Party Claim]. By Paul Bedard. ''[[US News and World Report]]''. Published April 4, 2009.</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *{{cite web |title=Official Website |url=http://www.dontgomovement.com:80/ |archivedate=April 17, 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090417111912/http://www.dontgomovement.com/ |deadurl=yes |df= }} {{Tea Party movement}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Dontgo}} [[Category:Political organizations in the United States]] [[Category:Non-profit organizations based in the United States]] [[Category:Tea Party movement]] [[Category:2008 establishments in the United States]]
