revision.comment: /* A threat to its families, education */
revision.text:
{{Infobox Encyclical | name = Summi Pontificatus | language = Latin | translation = Of the Supreme Pontificate | argument = On the Unity of Human Society | date = 20 October 1939 | pope = Pius XII | papal_coat_of_arms = Coat of arms of Pope Pius XII.svg | pages = | number = 1 of 41 | before = Ingravescentibus malis | after = [[Sertum laetitiae]] | web_en = http://www.vatican.va/holy_father/pius_xii/encyclicals/documents/hf_p-xii_enc_20101939_summi-pontificatus_en.html | web_la = http://www.vatican.va/holy_father/pius_xii/encyclicals/documents/hf_p-xii_enc_20101939_summi-pontificatus_lt.html }} {{italic title}} [[Image:PiusXIISaluspopuli.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Pope Pius XII.]] '''''Summi Pontificatus''''' is an [[encyclical]] of [[Pope Pius XII]] published on 20 October 1939. The encyclical is subtitled "On the Unity of Human Society."<ref>''Summi Pontificatus'', October 20, 1939; AAS 31 (1939) 423 ff.</ref> It was the first encyclical of Pius XII and was seen as setting "a tone" for his papacy. It critiques major errors at the time, such as [[ideologies]] of [[racism]], cultural superiority and the [[totalitarian state]]. It also sets the theological framework for future encyclical letters, such as ''[[Mystici corporis Christi]]'' (1943). The encyclical laments the [[invasion of Poland (1939)|destruction of Poland]], denounces the [[Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact]], and calls for a restoration of independent [[History of Poland|Poland]].
==The Unity of Human Society== ''Summi Pontificatus'' sees [[Christianity]] being universalized and opposed to racial hostility and superiority. There are no racial differences, because the [[human race]] forms a unity, because "one ancestor [Adam] made all nations to inhabit the whole earth".
* What a wonderful vision, which makes us contemplate the human race in the unity of its origin in God. . . in the unity of its nature, composed equally in all men of a material body and a spiritual soul; in the unity of its immediate end and its mission in the world; in the unity of its dwelling, the earth, whose benefits all men, by right of nature, may use to sustain and develop life; in the unity of its supernatural end: God himself, to whom all ought to tend; in the unity of the means for attaining this end;. . . in the unity of the redemption wrought by Christ for all.<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 38–39</ref>
This divine law of solidarity and [[Charity (virtue)|charity]] assures that all men are truly brethren, without excluding the rich variety of persons, cultures and societies.<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 35</ref>
===Human and cultural diversity=== ''Summi Pontificatus'' teaches, that superior and inferior cultures do not exist and that different levels of development within and between [[nations]] are source for enrichment of the human race. *The nations, despite a difference of development due to diverse conditions of life and [[cultural diversity|of culture]], are not destined to break the unity of the human race, but rather to enrich and embellish it by the sharing of their own peculiar gifts and by that reciprocal interchange of goods.<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 43</ref>
===Solidarity and charity=== Because of their common origin and their ensuing equality, [[solidarity]] and charity are mandatory for all people. The principle of solidarity, which can be articulated in terms of "friendship" or "social charity," is a direct demand of human and Christian brotherhood.
* An error, "today abundantly widespread, is disregard for the law of human solidarity and charity, dictated and imposed both by our common origin and by the equality in rational nature of all men, whatever nation they belong to. This law is sealed by the sacrifice of redemption offered by Jesus Christ on the altar of the Cross to his heavenly Father, on behalf of sinful humanity."<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 35</ref>
Forgetfulness of the law of universal charity may lead to conflict and war. Charity alone can create and consolidate peace by extinguishing hatred and softening envies and dissensions in the [[international relations|relations between nations]].<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 51</ref>
==The totalitarian state== In what most saw as a rejection of totalitarianism, ''Summi Pontificatus'' rejected the idea of the state as "something ultimate to which everything else should be subordinated":
*But there is yet another error no less pernicious to the well-being of the nations and to the prosperity of that great human society which gathers together and embraces within its confines all races. It is the error contained in those ideas which do not hesitate to divorce civil authority from every kind of dependence upon the Supreme Being—First Source and absolute Master of man and of society—and from every restraint of a Higher Law derived from God as from its First Source. Thus they accord the civil authority an unrestricted field of action that is at the mercy of the changeful tide of human will, or of the dictates of casual historical claims, and of the interests of a few."<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 52</ref>
===A threat to its families, education=== ''Summi Pontificatus'' goes on to show that unlimited state authority is a menace to the prosperity of nations, to the family and to education.
Further, the unlimited authority of the state would present a danger to the primary and essential cell of society, the [[family]], which in a totalitarian system would be viewed from the narrow standpoint of national power. That is contrary to Church teaching, which holds that the family has priority before the state:
*However, and lest it be forgotten that man and the family are by nature anterior to the State, and that the Creator has given to both of them powers and rights and has assigned them a mission and a charge that correspond to undeniable natural requirements.<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 61</ref>
''Summi Pontificatus'' holds that in that case [[education]] would aim at "a one-sided formation of those civic virtues that are considered necessary for attaining political success, while the virtues which give society the fragrance of nobility, humanity and reverence would be inculcated less, for fear they should detract from the pride of the citizen."<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 62</ref> This would "bear most bitter fruits". The encyclical concedes that formation should prepare the youth to fulfill "the offices of a noble patriotism which give to one's earthly fatherland all due measure of love, self-devotion and service", it adds that "a formation which forgot or, worse still, deliberately neglected to direct the eyes and hearts of youth to the heavenly country would be an injustice".<ref>Pius XII, Enc''. Summi Pontificatus'', n 67</ref>
===A danger to World peace=== The principles of [[natural law|natural]] and [[international law]] are not an option but indispensable, because the totalitarian state is a threat to [[world peace|peace]]:
* The idea which credits the State with unlimited authority is not simply an error harmful to the internal life of nations, to their prosperity, and to the larger and well-ordered increase in their well-being, but likewise it injures the relations between peoples, for it breaks the unity of supra-national society, robs the law of nations of its foundation and vigor, leads to violation of others' rights and impedes agreement and peaceful intercourse.<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 70</ref>
===The German/Russian attack on Poland=== ''Summi Pontificatus'', in line with the theological and non-political nature of Papal encyclicals of the past, does not mention explicitly definite names or countries, as many of his accusations against racism, racial segregation superiority and exploitation are far-reaching and of a moral nature. An exception is the fate of [[occupation of Poland|occupied]] [[Second Polish Republic|Poland]]. For its specific criticism of the attack and occupation of Poland the encyclical was lauded by the western Allies, and Polish refugees outside Nazi and Soviet control likewise approved of the pope's call for restoration of an independent Polish state.{{cn|date=December 2016}}
* "The blood of countless human beings, even noncombatants, raises a piteous dirge over a nation such as Our dear Poland, which, for its fidelity to the Church, for its services in the defense of [[Christian civilization]], written in indelible characters in the annals of history, has a right to the generous and brotherly sympathy of the whole world, while it awaits, relying on the powerful intercession of Mary, Help of Christians, the hour of a resurrection in harmony with the principles of justice and true peace."<ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 106</ref>
==Consequences== ''Summi Pontificatus'' incorporates elements of the draft for an encyclical, ''[[Humani generis unitas]]'', against [[racism]] and anti-semitism, prepared by several [[Jesuits]] for their Father General. [[Pope Pius XI]] was editing and putting the finishing touches on it when he died in February 1939, and his successor, [[Pope Pius XII]], subsequently choose not to publish it, possibly in light of strong [[anti-Judaism|anti-Judaic]] or anti-rabbinic language in parts of it, which could be misunderstood by the faithful or perverted by pro-Axis media.<ref>Georges Passselecp, Berard Suchecky, ''L'Encyclique Cachée De Pii XI'', Paris, 1995</ref> Some 50 years later, this created some controversy, as to whether the new Pope should have published, without changes or additions, the draft of an encyclical letter presented for his predecessor's consideration.<ref>Church practice and [[Canon Law]], did not require publication. The last encyclical that Pius XII was preparing was not issued after his death in 1958 by his successor [[Pope John XXIII]]. [[Pope Benedict XVI]] incorporated parts of an unpublished last encyclical from [[Pope John Paul II]] in his first letter, ''[[Deus caritas est]]''.</ref>
===International reactions === Contemporaneous reactions to ''Summi Pontificatus'' were strong. While some [[Nazis]] played it down, Von Bergen, the German ambassador to the Vatican, said: "Pope Pius wanted to hit with this encyclical primarily the Third Reich."<ref>Johanna Schmid, Papst Pius Begegnen. Augsburg, 2001, P.80</ref> The [[Catholic League (U.S.)|Catholic League]] (U.S.) stated that the Gestapo considered the encyclical an attack. The [[United Kingdom|British]] and [[France|French]] authorities at war with [[Germany]] welcomed it and the French had copies printed and dropped by air over Germany. Germany stopped its printing and distribution and the Gestapo ordered enquiries into people who read or tried to distribute it. ''[[The New York Times]]'' published the encyclical on 28 October 1939 under the headline: "Dictators, Treaty-Breaking and Racism are Condemned by the Pope in his First Encyclical" writing: ''"A powerful attack on totalitarianism and the evils which he considers it has brought upon the world was made by Pope Pius XII in his first encyclical…It is Germany that stands condemned above any country or any movement in this encyclical-the Germany of Hitler and National Socialism."''<ref>{{cite news|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1939/10/28/113368165.pdf |title=Dictators, Treaty-Breaking and Racism are Condemned by the Pope in his First Encyclical |accessdate=February 11, 2014 |newspaper=The New York Times|date=October 28, 1938}}</ref>
The [[United States|American]] media, without grasping potential implications for domestic race relations, welcomed the decisive positions of the new Pope. More important, devout Catholic that he (Pope Pius XII) was, he knew which side he was for, and unlike Benedict XV during World War I, said so.
It certainly did the Allies no harm when 61,000,000 German and Polish Catholics were told by the leader of their religion that "the idea which credits the State with unlimited authority" was abhorrent to him. "To consider the State as something ultimate to which everything else should be subordinated and directed cannot fail to harm the true and lasting prosperity of nations," read the Encyclical. Again, the Pontiff wrote that the totalitarian system of government was an idea which "robs the law of nations of its foundation and vigor, leads to violation of others' rights and impedes agreement and peaceful intercourse".<ref>''Pius. No dove'', ''Time'' Magazine, November 6, 1939</ref>
=== A conclusion=== The encyclical letter had little or no political impact at the time. But ''Summi Pontificatus'' also predicted an ultimate victory against the enemies of the Church. "Her adversary can never prevail: The gates of hell shall not prevail, nor can they ever weaken her" <ref>Pius XII, Enc. ''Summi Pontificatus'' 104, 105</ref>
Theologically, the often quoted rationale about the unity of human society and diversity of cultures, is a part of the Magisterium of the Catholic Church and quoted in numerous Church documents. ''Summi Pontificatus'', despite of its lack of "political success" remains thus one of the more influential theological encyclicals of Pope Pius XII.
==See also== *[[List of encyclicals of Pope Pius XII]]
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
==Sources== * [http://www.vatican.va/holy_father/pius_xii/encyclicals/documents/hf_p-xii_enc_20101939_summi-pontificatus_en.html Encyclical ''Summi Pontificatus'' on the Vatican website]
{{Pope Pius XII|state=collapsed}} {{Authority control}}
[[Category:Pope Pius XII encyclicals]] [[Category:History of Catholicism in Poland]] [[Category:History of Catholicism in Germany]] [[Category:Religion and politics]] [[Category:Politics of World War II]] [[Category:Racism]] [[Category:October 1939 events]] [[Category:1939 documents]] [[Category:1939 in Christianity]]

page.title: The Irregular at Magic High School

revision.text:
{{good article}} {{Infobox animanga/Header | name = The Irregular at Magic High School | image = File:Irregular at Magic High School LN 1.png | caption = The first light novel volume of ''The Irregular at Magic High School'' published by Dengeki Bunko. It features Tatsuya and Miyuki on the cover. | ja_kanji = 魔法科高校の劣等生 | ja_romaji = Mahōka Kōkō no Rettōsei | genre = [[Action fiction|Action]], [[fantasy]]{{cite web |url=https://www.rightstufanime.com/The-Irregular-at-Magic-High-School-Set-1-BD-S|title=The Irregular At Magic High School Set 1 Blu-Ray|publisher=[[Right Stuf Inc.]] |accessdate=January 21, 2018}} }} {{Infobox animanga/Print | type = novel series | title = | author = Tsutomu Satō | illustrator = | publisher = [[Shōsetsuka ni Narō]] | first = October 12, 2008 | last = March 21, 2011 | volumes = 6 | volume_list = }} {{Infobox animanga/Print | type = light novel | author = Tsutomu Satō | illustrator = Kana Ishida | publisher = [[ASCII Media Works]] | publisher_en = {{English manga publisher|NA=[[Yen Press]]}} | demographic = Male | imprint = [[Dengeki Bunko]] | first = July 10, 2011 | last = | volumes = 26 + 10 side stories | volume_list = #Volume list }} {{Infobox animanga/Video | type = tv series | director = Manabu Ono | producer = Kazuma Miki
Kozue Kananiwa
Shinitirou Kashiwada
Yasutaka Kimura | writer = Munemasa Nakamoto
Yukie Sugawara
Yukito Kizawa | music = [[Taku Iwasaki]] | studio = [[Madhouse (company)|Madhouse]] | licensee = {{English anime licensee|AUS=Hanabee|NA=[[Aniplex of America]]}} | network = [[Tokyo MX]], [[Gunma TV]], GYT, [[Mainichi Broadcasting System|MBS]], [[Chiba TV]], [[Television Kanagawa|tvk]], [[TV Saitama]], [[TV Aichi]], [[TVQ Kyushu Broadcasting|TVQ]], [[Television Hokkaido|TVh]], [[AT-X (company)|AT-X]], [[Nippon BS Broadcasting|BS11]] | network_en = {{English anime network|SEA=[[Animax Asia]]}} | first = April 6, 2014 | last = September 27, 2014 | episodes = 26 | episode_list = List of The Irregular at Magic High School episodes }} {{Infobox animanga/Other | title = Film | content = *''[[The Irregular at Magic High School The Movie: The Girl Who Calls the Stars]]'' }} {{Infobox animanga/Footer}} {{Nihongo|'''''The Irregular at Magic High School'''''|魔法科高校の劣等生|Mahōka Kōkō no Rettōsei|{{lit}} "The Poor Performing Student of a Magic High School"}} is a Japanese [[web novel]] series by Tsutomu Satō. It was published on [[Shōsetsuka ni Narō]], an internet web novel website, between October 2008 and March 2011. Satō reached a deal with [[Dengeki Bunko]] and began releasing his work in a [[light novel]] format beginning July 2011. In 2013, each [[story arc]] received a [[manga]] adaptation with varying [[manga artist]]s and publishers. That same year, an [[anime]] adaptation by [[Madhouse (company)|Madhouse]] was announced and was broadcast between April and September 2014. ''The Irregular at Magic High School'' franchise had been localized for English by two companies: The light novels and one of the manga adaptations are licensed by [[Yen Press]] while [[Aniplex of America]] licensed the anime series. The anime series was [[simulcast]]ed on four networks, and was later made available on [[Netflix]]. The story takes place in an [[alternate history]] where magic exists and is polished through modern technology. It follows Tatsuya and Miyuki Shiba, siblings who enroll into First High magic high school. While keeping their connections to the infamous Yotsuba clan secret, they attempt to live their daily life in peace where Tatsuya is shunned for his apparent ineptness and Miyuki is validated for her magical abilities. The series has been well received. The light novels appeared on Sugoi Japan's 2015 polls and since 2011, is one of the top selling series in Japan with 7.7 million copies sold as of 2017. In addition, its manga and anime adaptations also appeared on top selling charts. English reviewers had mixed to negative reception towards the anime adaptation. The complex technicality of magic within the series was received warmly but the exposition was criticized for being heavy, unclear, and poorly executed. ==Plot== The series is set in a world with an [[alternate history]], where magic exists and has been polished through modern technology. However, the ability to use magic is determined by genetics, limiting the number of magicians in existence. Following the Third World War, the world's [[superpower]]s shifted to these four nations: The United States of North America (USNA), New Soviet Union, the Great Asian Alliance, and Japan. In Japan, the magic community is informally governed by the ten master clans in lieu of the government. Due to the limited number of magicians, they are treated as a commodity and are forced to enter magic related schools and professions. Nine magic high schools exist in Japan; they each specialize in different aspects of magic and are simply referred to by their numbers. The story follows Tatsuya Shiba, a bodyguard to his sister Miyuki Shiba who is also a candidate to succeed the leadership of the Yotsuba clan, one of the Ten Master Clans that govern Japan's magicians. They enroll into First High School which segregates its students based on their magical abilities. Miyuki is enrolled as a first course student and is viewed as one of the best students, while Tatsuya is in the second course and considered to be magically inept. However, Tatsuya's technical knowledge, combat abilities, and unique magic techniques cause people to view him as an irregular to the school's standardized rankings. ===Characters=== ====Main characters==== ;{{Nihongo4|{{vanchor|Tatsuya Shiba}}|司波 達也|Shiba Tatsuya}} and {{Nihongo4|{{vanchor|Miyuki Shiba}}|司波 深雪|Shiba Miyuki}} Tatsuya and Miyuki are siblings of the same school year and children to Tatsurou Shiba and the late Miya Yotsuba;{{Ref|LN|LN 3.2}} their parents had a loveless [[forced marriage]], and when their mother died, their father married his mistress, Sayuri Furuha, leaving the siblings to live by themselves.{{Ref|LN|LN 6.2}} Maya Yotsuba, their aunt and the current leader of the Yotsuba Clan, was the reason Tatsuya was born with the unique magic to decompose, reconstruct, and detonate matter.{{Ref|LN|LN 16.6}} Out of fear of his powers, the Yotsuba Clan leadership of that time argued for Tatsuya's death, forcing Miya and Maya to take measures to ensure his survival: the first was Miyuki's creation who would act as a seal to Tatsuya's power; the second was to magically dull Tatsuya's emotions except for his familial love towards Miyuki; and the third was to assign Tatsuya to be Miyuki's bodyguard in order to develop his sense of loyalty towards her.{{Ref|LN|LN 16.6}} During a family vacation in Okinawa, Tatsuya warded off an invasion by the Great Asian Alliance and joined the 101 Independent Magic-Equipped Battalion which is headed by [[Major]] Kazama Harunobu.{{Ref|LN|LN 8.7}} At some point during his life Tatsuya developed an interest in engineering magical technology and commercialized revolutionary technology through his family's company, Four Leaves Technology, under the pseudonymous identity Taurus Silver.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.2}} He is voiced by [[Yuichi Nakamura (voice actor)|Yuichi Nakamura]].{{cite web| url=http://mahouka.us/staff/| title=Staff and Cast| publisher=Mahouka.Us| accessdate=October 2, 2015| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150929154100/http://mahouka.us/staff/| archivedate=September 29, 2015| df=}} Miyuki is considered one of the strongest magicians in the world and is a candidate to succeed her Aunt Maya as the leader of the Yotsuba Clan. Her specialty is freezing magic, and her unique magic allows her to freeze a person's consciousness. In addition, half of her magic casting ability is used to seal Tatsuya's powers. Before the family vacation in Okinawa, Miyuki treated Tatsuya coldly akin to how the other Yotsuba Clan members did. She began to warm up to him and when Tatsuya saved her life, she devoted her entire existence to him. It evolved to the point where she disdains the touch of other males and expresses jealousy towards females around Tatsuya.{{Ref|LN|LN 11.15}} Genetically different from Tatsuya despite being born from the same parents, Miyuki professes her love to him following their engagement under Maya's orders.{{Ref|LN|LN 16.6}} She is voiced by [[Saori Hayami]]. In the polls by [[Kono Light Novel ga Sugoi!]], both Tatsuya and Miyuki ranked as one of the most popular light novel characters.{{cite book| title=Kono Light Novel ga Sugoi! 2014| publisher=Takarajimasha| isbn=978-4-8002-1954-1| date=November 20, 2013| language=Japanese}} Outside of the franchise, Tatsuya and Miyuki also appear in ''[[Dengeki Bunko: Fighting Climax]]''.{{cite web| url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2014-05-09/toradora-taiga-the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-miyuki| title=''Toradora''{{'}}s Taiga, ''The Irregular at Magic High School''{{'}}s Miyuki Join ''Dengeki Bunko Fighting Climax''| date=May 9, 2014| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| accessdate=October 24, 2015}} ====Supporting characters==== =====Tatsuya's group===== Tatsuya's group consists of seven classmates whom he spends time with in his daily school life. They often assist Tatsuya during investigations and dangerous situations. *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Erika Chiba}}|千葉 エリカ|Chiba Erika|group=Jp.}} is the daughter of the Chiba clan's leader and his mistress, which creates a strained relationship with her family. She has a tomboyish and optimistic personality, and is considered one of the best swordsmen in the clan.{{Ref|LN|LN 7.11}} Her magic is used to enhance her sword and combat techniques. She considers Mizuki to be her best friend and has a crush on Tatsuya.{{Ref|LN|LN 8.10}} She is voiced by [[Yumi Uchiyama]]. *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Leonhard Saijo}}|西城 レオンハルト|Saijō Reonharuto|group=Jp.}}, commonly referred to as Leo, is the grandson of a Fortress Series modified magician.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.4}} His grandfather was one of the few survivors of the Fortress Series' instabilities, which causes early death or psychosis. Leo inherited his grandfather's physical augmentations and fears he may also have inherited the Fortress Series' faults.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.4}} During combat, Leo uses magic to fortify objects or his own body to augment his combat abilities. He is voiced by [[Takuma Terashima]]. *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Mizuki Shibata}}|柴田 美月|Shibata Mizuki|group=Jp.}} is a girl with the disposition called crystal eyes which allows her to see the components of magic invisible to most people.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.3}} Her ability mentally strains her, requiring her to wear glasses to control her vision. She has a timid, calm, and feminine personality, and is voiced by [[Satomi Sato]]. *{{Nihongo foot|Mikihiko Yoshida|吉田 幹比古|Yoshida Mikihiko|group=Jp.}} is a prodigy from the Yoshida clan which specializes in magic dealing with spirits. Years prior to the series Mikihiko failed a summoning ritual which created a psychological block and prevented him from using magic effectively. His involvement with Tatsuya restores his confidence, allowing him to regain his magical talents. He is voiced by [[Atsushi Tamaru]]. *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Honoka Mitsui}}|光井 ほのか|Mitsui Honoka|group=Jp.}} is a descendant of a group of extinct magicians referred to as the Elements.{{Ref|LN|LN 6.7}} The Elements specialize in one of the six elements of magic and had loyalty genetically embedded into their genes. Honoka uses light magic, and her genetic loyalty is directed towards Tatsuya. She is voiced by [[Sora Amamiya]]. *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Shizuku Kitayama}}|北山 雫|Kitayama Shizuku|group=Jp.}} is Honoka's best friend and daughter to an extremely wealthy man.{{Ref|LN|LN 4.1}} Shizuku is a mature and tactful girl who rarely shows emotion. She inherited her mother's talent for oscillation magic. She is voiced by [[Yuiko Tatsumi]]. *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Minami Sakurai}}|桜井 水波|Sakurai Minami|group=Jp.}} is the niece of Hoonami Sakurai, Miya Yotsuba's guardian.{{Ref|LN|LN 12.1}} Both Minami and Hoonami were artificially created by the Yotsuba to serve the clan as bodyguards, and they specialize in barrier type magic. Minami is Miyuki's junior and serves as her maid and second bodyguard.{{Ref|LN|LN 12.1}} =====Student Council and Disciplinary Committee===== The [[student council]] is a group of students which provides a liaison between the teachers and students. Meanwhile, the Disciplinary Committee consists of students who are essentially rule enforcers. A third committee is the Extracurricular Activities Federation who ensures that school clubs don't come into conflict with each other. The three committees are closely related and work together to preserve the peace on campus. {{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Mayumi Saegusa}}|七草 真由美|Saegusa Mayumi|group=Jp.}} is the student council president during the Shiba siblings' first year at school.{{Ref|LN|LN 1.2}} She puts on a coy and innocent facade but is actually mischievous and highly perceptive. Mayumi is talented as a sniper and her form of offensive magic involves firing dry ice as projectiles.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.5}} During the course of the story, she manipulates Miyuki into joining the student council and Tatsuya into the Disciplinary Committee. She develops an attraction to Tatsuya and places him in awkward situations for fun. After enrolling into Magic University, her twin sisters, Kasumi and Izumi Saegusa, enroll into First High.{{Ref|LN|LN 12.6}} Mayumi is voiced by [[Kana Hanazawa]]. Two people worked alongside Mayumi during the year. The first was {{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Mari Watanabe}}|渡辺 摩利|Watanabe Mari|group=Jp.}} who was the leader of the Disciplinary Committee.{{Ref|LN|LN 1.2}} Mari has a tomboyish personality but becomes completely feminine in front of her boyfriend, Chiba Naotsugu, who is also Erika's half brother.{{Ref|LN|LN 4.10}} For combat, she uses a whip like blade and uses magic to manipulate chemicals.{{Ref|LN|LN 6.6}} Second is {{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Katsuto Jumonji}}|十文字 克人|Jūmonji Katsuto|group=Jp.}}, the leader of the Extracurricular Activities Federation.{{Ref|LN|LN 2.6}} Katsuto is the next head of the Jumonji clan and inherited the clans barrier magic, Phalanx: an impenetrable and perpetual barrier used for defensive and offensive purposes.{{Ref|LN|LN 4.12}} Both the Saegusa and Jumonji are members of the Ten Master Clans, forcing Mayumi and Katsuto to be politically involved with the magic community outside of school. Watanabe is voiced by [[Marina Inoue]] while Jumonji is voiced by [[Junichi Suwabe]]. During the Shiba siblings' second year, Mayumi is succeeded as student council president by {{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Azusa Nakajou}}|中条 あずさ|Nakajō Azusa|group=Jp.}}, a timid and youthful looking girl.{{Ref|LN|LN 5.6}} Azusa has an interest in magic engineering and suspects Tatsuya is secretly Taurus Silver. She is able to use a unique magic named after her, Azusa Dream, to forcefully pacify people.{{Ref|LN|LN 7.10}} Mari is succeeded as chairman of the Disciplinary Committee by {{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Kanon Chiyoda}}|千代田 花音|Chiyoda Kanon|group=Jp.}}, an impulsive and good-natured girl.{{Ref|LN|LN 6.1}} She is engaged to {{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Kei Isori}}|五十里 啓|Isori Kei|group=Jp.}}, an androgynous and timid boy, and loves him dearly.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.4}} Azusa Nakajou is voiced by Saki Ogasawara, Kanon Chiyoda is voiced by [[Saori Onishi]], and Kei Isori is voiced by [[Sōma Saitō]].{{cite web| url=http://mahouka.us/character/#c27| title=Kanon Chiyoda character profile| publisher=Mahouka.Us| accessdate=October 2, 2015| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151012201618/http://mahouka.us/character/#c27| archivedate=October 12, 2015| df=}}{{cite web| url=http://mahouka.us/character/#c26| title=Kei Isori character profile| publisher=Mahouka.Us| accessdate=October 2, 2015| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151012201618/http://mahouka.us/character/#c26| archivedate=October 12, 2015| df=}} =====Other characters===== *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Masaki Ichijo}}|一条 将輝|Ichijō Masaki|group=Jp.}} is a first-year student from Third High School and the successor to the head of the Ichijo clan, another of the Ten Master Clans.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.4}} His combat magic includes manipulating air, water molecules, and his unique magic allows him to evaporate water within an organism causing it to explode. He is often accompanied by his best friend, {{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Shinkuro Kichijoji}}|吉祥寺 真紅郎|Kichijōji Shinkurō|group=Jp.}}, who is credited as discovering one of the sixteen [[code]]s fundamental to magic.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.4}} Shinkuro feels indebted to the Ichijo family for adopting him after his parents' death and promises to serve them forever. After losing the nine school competition, they both seek to improve themselves to overcome Tatsuya.{{Ref|LN|LN 5.4}} Masaki is voiced by [[Yoshitsugu Matsuoka]] while Shinkuro by [[Ayumu Murase]]. *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Haruka Ono}}|小野 遥|Ono Haruka|group=Jp.}} is an undercover agent for the Ministry of Public Safety who infiltrates the school as a counselor.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.1}} She takes both of her duties seriously and frequently assists Tatsuya in gathering information. In addition, Haruka's disposition enhances her innate concealment magic; she trains under Yakumo Kokonoe to further enhance her hiding abilities.{{Ref|LN|LN 3.1}} She is voiced by [[Sakura Tange]].{{cite web| url=http://mahouka.us/character/#c23| title=Haruka Ono character profile| publisher=Mahouka.Us| accessdate=October 2, 2015| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151012201618/http://mahouka.us/character/#c23| archivedate=October 12, 2015| df=}} *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Yakumo Kokonoe}}|九重 八雲|Kokonoe Yakumo|group=Jp.}} is a master of ninjutsu, a minority and an older form of magic.{{Ref|LN|LN 1.2}} He chooses to isolate himself from magician politics and spends most of his time gathering information and training his disciples. He is voiced by [[Ryōtarō Okiayu]]{{cite web| url=http://mahouka.us/character/#c20| title=Yakumo Kokonoe character profile| publisher=Mahouka.Us| accessdate=October 2, 2015| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151012201618/http://mahouka.us/character/#c20| archivedate=October 12, 2015| df=}} *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Pixy}}|ピクシー|Pikushī|group=Jp.}} is a Home Automation Robot, an android designed to serve humans. She was created and owned by First High's robotics club. During the ''Visitor Arc'', she is used as a physical vessel by one of a group of ethereal supernatural sentient entities referred to as parasites.{{Ref|LN|LN 6.7}} The parasite began identifying itself as Pixy, and due to Honoka's presence, has developed feelings of love towards Tatsuya. Tatsuya buys her to prevent the magic community from militarizing the parasite inside her.{{Ref|LN|LN 6.8}} She is voiced by [[Nao Tōyama]].{{cite web| url=http://mahouka.us/character/#c44| title=Pixy character profile| publisher=Mahouka.Us| accessdate=October 2, 2015| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151012201618/http://mahouka.us/character/#c44| archivedate=October 12, 2015| df=}} *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Zhou Gongjin}}|周 公瑾|Shū Kōkin|group=Jp.}} is a middle-man who orchestrated all major conflicts in the series. He is part of an unknown organization led by {{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Jiedo Heigu}}|ジード・ヘイグ|Jīdo Heigu|group=Jp.}} who wishes to destroy the Yotsuba. Zhou is voiced by [[Kōji Yusa]].{{cite web| url=http://mahouka.us/character/#c34| title=Zhou Gongjin character profile| publisher=Mahouka.Us| accessdate=October 2, 2015| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151012201618/http://mahouka.us/character/#c34| archivedate=October 12, 2015| df=}} *{{Nihongo foot|{{vanchor|Angelina Kudo Shields}}|アンジェリーナ・クドウ・シールズ|Anjerīna Kudou Shīruzu|group=Jp.}} is the leader of the USNA's magician army force known as Stars.{{Ref|LN|LN 7.1}} Her military identity is Angie Sirius, and she is one of the thirteen publicly declared [[Strategic weapon|strategic]] magicians. She is voiced by [[Yōko Hikasa]].{{cite web| url=http://mahouka-ooo.bngames.net/chara/angelina.php| title=Angelina ''Out of Order'' profile| publisher=[[Bandai Namco Entertainment]]| language=Japanese| accessdate=October 24, 2015}} ==Publication and conception== The story was conceived around a protagonist whose abilities cannot be properly measured through standardized evaluation;{{Ref|LN|LN 2.A}} as such, he is mistakenly categorized as a poor performing student or an irregular. This premise served as a basis for the character, Tatsuya Shiba.{{Ref|LN|LN 2.A}} Satō has two processes for scripting the story arcs: the first is to create scenarios to have characters behave and interact in certain ways; the second is to plan a scene, then script the story so it leads to that scene.{{Ref|LN|LN 11.A}} Satō professed that he does not feel his characters are alive or have a will of their own when scripting them.{{Ref|LN|LN 11.A}} Tsutomu Satō published his work on the online web novel website, [[Shōsetsuka ni Narō]], between October 12, 2008 and March 21, 2011.{{cite web| url=http://ncode.syosetu.com/n2569f/| title=''The Irregular at Magic High School'' official web novel website| publisher=Syosetu.com| language=Japanese| accessdate=August 4, 2015}}{{dead link|date=February 2018|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} At some point during his publication on Syosetu, Satō sent an original work to [[Dengeki Bunko]] under a pseudonym.{{Ref|LN|LN 1.A}} The original work's setting shared similarities to ''The Irregular at Magic High School'' causing an editor to deduce his identity and offer him a publication deal.{{Ref|LN|LN 1.A}} On March 11, 2011, the author announced his work is going to be published as a [[light novel]] under the Dengeki Bunko [[Imprint (trade name)|imprint]].{{cite web| archiveurl=https://archive.is/20111205192015/http://mypage.syosetu.com/mypageblog/view/userid/28800/blogkey/153004| archivedate=December 5, 2011| url=http://mypage.syosetu.com/mypageblog/view/userid/28800/blogkey/153004| title=Important Announcement| first=Tsutomu| last=Satō| date=March 3, 2011| publisher=Syosetu.com| language=Japanese| dead-url=yes| accessdate=August 4, 2015}} The author expressed some regret turning free content into paid commodity and cited his financial needs as the reason.{{Ref|LN|LN 1.A}} The illustrations accompanying the light novels were done by Kana Ishida. The first light novel volume was unable to accommodate the first story arc; deciding against cutting content from the web novel, it was split into two volumes and released a month later.{{Ref|LN|LN 2.A}} On March 9, 2015, [[Yen Press]] announced its licensing of the light novels for English localization through [[Twitter]].{{cite web| url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2015-03-09/yen-press-licenses-irregular-at-magic-high-school-light-novels-manga/.85777| title=Yen Press Licenses ''Irregular at Magic High School'' Light Novels, Manga| date=March 9, 2015| publisher=[[Anime News Network]]| accessdate=October 24, 2015}} Yen Press' first volume was released in April 2016. ===Volume list=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: left" |- ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" width="5%" rowspan=2| No. ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" width="40%" rowspan=2| Translated title ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" colspan=2| Japanese ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" colspan=2| English |- style="border-bottom:3px; solid; background: #CCF;" ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" "width="5%"| Release ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" "width="5%"| ISBN ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" "width="5%"| Release ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" "width="5%"| ISBN |- !scope="row" |1 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Enrollment Arc (I)|入学編 〈上〉|Nyūgaku-hen (Jō)|group=Jp.}} |July 10, 2011{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-870597-4/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 1|publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=December 26, 2013| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-870597-4}} |April 19, 2016{{cite web |url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/tsutomu-sato/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-1-light-novel/9780316348805/?yen |title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 1 (light novel) |website=[[Hachette Book Group]] |accessdate=January 2, 2018 }} |{{ISBNT|978-0-316-34880-5}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|The siblings [[#Tatsuya Shiba|Tatsuya]] and [[#Miyuki Shiba|Miyuki Shiba]] begin their first day at First High School, one of the nine magic high schools in Japan; the school segregates its students as first course or second course based on overall magic ability. Miyuki is considered a prodigy within first course, and is recruited as a member of the Student Council, while Tatsuya faces scorn and prejudice alongside his peers in the second course. A scuffle caused by a first course student reveals Tatsuya's ability to predict magic before it is cast, causing him to be recruited by the Disciplinary Committee through Miyuki's endorsement; in order to defend Miyuki's honor, Tatsuya displays his combat abilities to the Student Council, proving his competency as an enforcer. Shortly after, Tatsuya intervenes in a scuffle between the kendo and kenjutsu clubs and overwhelms the latter with his physical abilities. |- !scope="row" |2 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Enrollment Arc (II)|入学編 〈下〉|Nyūgaku-hen (Ge)|group=Jp.}} |August 10, 2011{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-870598-1/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 2| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-870598-1}} |August 23, 2016{{cite web |url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/tsutomu-sato/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-2-light-novel/9780316390293/?yen |title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 2 (light novel) |website=[[Hachette Book Group]] |accessdate=January 2, 2018 }} |{{ISBNT|978-0-316-39029-3}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Tatsuya garners the attention of an anti-magician organization called Blanche, who send a classmate named Sayaka Mibu to recruit him. After Tatsuya declines her invitation, Blanche invades First High to steal its research. Tatsuya and friends foil their attempt and attacks their headquarters in return. Learning that the head of Blanche used mind controlling magic on Sayaka and other student collaborators, Tatsuya was able to establish their innocence, absolving them of any crime. |- !scope="row" |3 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Nine School Competition Arc (I)|九校戦編〈上〉|Kyūkōsen-hen (Jō)|group=Jp.}} |November 10, 2011{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-870998-9/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 3| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-870998-9}} |December 20, 2016{{cite web |url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/tsutomu-sato/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-3-light-novel/9780316390309/?yen |title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 3 (light novel) |website=[[Hachette Book Group]] |accessdate=January 2, 2018 }} |{{ISBNT|978-0-316-39030-9}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|The Nine School Competition is Japan's national sporting event which pits the nine magic schools against each other. Miyuki is elected as a contestant while Tatsuya reluctantly joins the team as an engineer. During the competition, an international criminal syndicate named No Head Dragon makes several attempts to rig the contest by sabotaging First High, which eventually injures their teammate, [[#Mari Watanabe|Mari Watanabe]]. With Miyuki forced to substitute for her, Tatsuya enlists the help of his friends to assist in his investigation before Miyuki becomes a target of sabotage. |- !scope="row" |4 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Nine School Competition Arc (II)|九校戦編〈下〉|Kyūkōsen-hen (Ge)|group=Jp.}} |December 10, 2011{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-870999-6/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 4| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-870999-6}} |April 18, 2017{{cite web |url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/tsutomu-sato/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-4-light-novel/9780316390316/?yen |title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 4 (light novel) |website=[[Hachette Book Group]] |accessdate=January 2, 2018 }} |{{ISBNT|978-0-316-39031-6}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|It is revealed No Head Dragon has placed bets on the competition and require First High to lose. Tatsuya, [[#Leonhard Saijo|Leonhard Saijo]], and [[#Mikihiko Yoshida|Mikihiko Yoshida]] are substituted in as players after No Head Dragon injures the original First High team for the Monolith Code competition, and under Tatsuya's leadership they are able to win first place. After catching a member of No Head Dragon attempting to sabotage Miyuki's equipment, Tatsuya retaliates by killing every member of the organization based within Japan. The competition concludes with First High achieving first place overall. |- !scope="row" |5 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Summer Vacation Arc +1|夏休み編+1|Natsuyasumi-hen +1|group=Jp.}} |April 10, 2012{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-886522-7/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 5| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-886522-7}} |August 22, 2017{{cite web |url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/tsutomu-sato/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-5-light-novel/9780316390323/?yen |title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 5 (light novel) |website=[[Hachette Book Group]] |accessdate=January 2, 2018 }} |{{ISBNT|978-0-316-39032-3}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Several characters' summer vacations are highlighted. Most notably: Tatsuya and friends spend the day at [[#Shizuku Kitayama|Shizuku Kitayama]]'s private resort; [[#Masaki Ichijo|Masaki Ichijo]] and [[#Shinkuro Kichijoji|Shinkuro Kichijoji]] reflect on their defeat by Tatsuya; and Tatsuya recalls shopping with Miyuki at the mall. Afterwards, First High clubs begin planning their officer successions and Tatsuya is asked to convince [[#Azusa Nakajou|Azusa Nakajou]] to become the next Student Council president. |- !scope="row" |6 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Yokohama Disturbance Arc (I)|横浜騒乱編<上> |Yokohama Sōran-hen (Jō)|group=Jp.}} |July 10, 2012{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-886700-9/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 6| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-886700-9}} |December 19, 2017{{cite web |url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/tsutomu-sato/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-6-light-novel/9780316390330/?yen |title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 6 (light novel) |website=[[Hachette Book Group]] |accessdate=January 2, 2018 }} |{{ISBN|978-0-316-39033-0}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Tatsuya is asked to partake in the school's thesis competition. At the same time, his step-mother places an [[Out-of-place artifact|OOPart]] capable of storing magic into his care. Chen Xiangshan, a military captain from the Great Asian Alliance, leads a team in order to steal the OOPart. During the course of the novel, two First High students affiliated with Chen are detained by authorities after they were caught stealing information from First High's thesis project. |- !scope="row" |7 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Yokohama Disturbance Arc (II)|横浜騒乱編<下> |Yokohama Sōran-hen (Ge)|group=Jp.}} |September 10, 2012{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-886701-6/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 7| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-886701-6}} |March 27, 2018{{cite web |url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/tsutomu-sato/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-7-light-novel/9781975300074/?yen |title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 7 (light novel) |website=[[Hachette Book Group]] |accessdate=January 2, 2018 }} |{{ISBN|978-1-975-30007-4}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|The thesis competition begins in Yokohama where an army led by Chen initiates their attack. During the battle, Tatsuya's power and military status is revealed to his close peers; the battle concludes with Tatsuya using matter detonation, a [[Strategic weapon|strategic]] level magic, to destroy the invading naval ship and subsequently an entire Great Asian Alliance harbor. |- !scope="row" |8 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Recollection Arc|追憶編|Tsuioku-hen|group=Jp.}} |December 10, 2012{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-891158-0/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 8| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-891158-0}} |June 26, 2018{{cite web |url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/tsutomu-sato/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-8-light-novel/9781975327125/?yen |title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 8 (light novel) |website=[[Hachette Book Group]] |accessdate=January 2, 2018 }} |{{ISBN|978-1-975-32712-5}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|[[#Maya Yotsuba|Maya Yotsuba]] summons Tatsuya and Miyuki to discuss recent events. Miyuki reminisces how she and Tatsuya reached their current status quo. Three years ago, Tatsuya, Miyuki, their mother Miya, and a bodyguard named Hoonami Sakurai were vacationing in Okinawa. There, Miyuki warms up to Tatsuya, and Tatsuya develops a friendship with major Kazama Harunobu. During that time, an invasion by the Great Asian Alliance results in Hoonami's death, and is resolved with Tatsuya's matter detonation. Back in the present, Maya warns Tatsuya that his matter detonation has garnered the attention of the United States of North America (USNA). |- !scope="row" |9 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Visitor Arc (I)|来訪者編＜上＞|Raihōsha-hen (Jō)|group=Jp.}} |March 10, 2013{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-891423-9/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 9| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-891423-9}} |September 18, 2018{{cite web |url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/none/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-9-light-novel/9781975327149/?yen|title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 9 (light novel) |website=[[Yen Press]] |accessdate=April 3, 2018}} |{{ISBN|978-1-975-32714-9}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Following a black hole experiment in the USNA, deserters from the military flee to Japan. The Stars military unit pursue in order to execute the deserters and investigate the magician behind matter detonation. [[#Angelina Kudo Shields|Angelina Kudo Shields]] infiltrates First High to spy on Tatsuya and Miyuki. As the story progresses, the deserters' abnormal abilities and activities garner the interest of Japan's magic clans. After confronting Angelina and one of the deserters, Tatsuya trades his silence for her information. |- !scope="row" |10 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Visitor Arc (II)|来訪者編＜中＞|Raihōsha-hen (Chū)|group=Jp.}} |June 7, 2013{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-891609-7/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 10| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-891609-7}} |December 18, 2018{{Cite web|url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/none/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-10-light-novel/9781975327163/?yen|title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 10 (light novel) - Yen Press|website=www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-11}} |{{ISBN|978-1-975-32716-3}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Tatsuya deduces the deserters are possessed by sentient psychic energy beings which came from the magic dimension during the black hole experiment and are dubbed as parasites. When one of the parasites enters First High, it is defeated by Tatsuya's group and possess the android known as [[#Pixy|Pixy]]; the parasite is imprinted with Honoka's feelings and decides to serve Tatsuya. Meanwhile, the USNA suspect Tatsuya is the one behind matter detonation and orders Angelina to assassinate him. |- !scope="row" |11 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Visitor Arc (III)|来訪者編＜下＞|Raihōsha-hen (Ge)|group=Jp.}} |August 10, 2013{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-891610-3/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 11| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-891610-3}} |March 19, 2019{{Cite web|url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/none/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-11-light-novel/9781975327187/?yen|title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 11 (light novel) - Yen Press|website=www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-11}} |{{ISBN|978-1-975-32718-7}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Tatsuya defeats Angelina while the Yotsuba clan forces Stars to stand down. Knowing that the eleven other parasites will attempt to retrieve Pixy, Tatsuya's group uses her as bait. Several magic clans attempt to capture the parasites resulting in a large-scale battle. This concludes with Tatsuya and Miyuki destroying nine of the parasites, leaving the remaining two in the custody of the Kudo and Yotsuba clan. As Tatsuya and Miyuki enter their second year, Maya has [[#Minami Sakurai|Minami Sakurai]] assigned to be Miyuki's bodyguard. |- !scope="row" |12 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Double Seven Arc|ダブルセブン編|Daburu Sebun-hen|group=Jp.}} |October 10, 2013{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-866003-7/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 12| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-866003-7}} |June 18, 2019{{Cite web|url=http://www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com/titles/none/the-irregular-at-magic-high-school-vol-12-light-novel/9781975327200/?yen|title=The Irregular at Magic High School, Vol. 12 (light novel) - Yen Press|website=www.b2c.hachettebookgroup.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-11}} |{{ISBN|978-1-975-32720-0}} |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Tatsuya and Miyuki's second year begins. A student named Takumi Shippou holds a displaced grudge towards the Saegusa twins, Kasumi and Izumi, causing conflict throughout the novel. Eventually, Takumi's arrogance is quelled by Tatsuya and friends. Meanwhile, [[#Zhou Gongjin|Zhou Gongjin]] and the Saegusa clan cooperate to have the media denounce the magicians of Japan by scapegoating First High, but backfires when Tatsuya learns of their plans and demonstrates the concepts of a magician operated power source. By coincidence, Tatsuya also foils an attack on a famous actress while dealing with Takumi. |- !scope="row" |13 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Steeplechase Arc|スティープルチェース編|Sutīpuruchēsu-hen|group=Jp.}} |April 10, 2014{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-866507-0/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 13| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-866507-0}} |— |— |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|The Kudo clan have managed to create androids powered by parasites. In order to test these weapons, they decided to place these androids as obstacles in the Steeplechase event of the Nine Schools Competition. Aware of the dangers these weapons would pose to Miyuki, Tatsuya infiltrates and neutralizes the androids before the other players arrive. Behind the scenes, Zhou attempts to sabotage the parasites to discredit magicians as a way to denounce the Yotsuba; fed up with his actions, the Yotsuba begin their manhunt for him. |- !scope="row" |14 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Ancient City Insurrection Arc (I)|古都内乱編＜上＞|Koto Nairan-hen (Jō)|group=Jp.}} |September 10, 2014{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-866860-6/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 14| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-866860-6}} |— |— |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Tatsuya is ordered to participate in the hunt for Zhou. Several clues reveal Zhou is hidden by the [[traditional values|traditionalist]] magicians. Tatsuya requests aid from the Kudo clan who are knowledgeable about the traditionalist. Led by Minoru Kudo, Tatsuya's group confronts the traditionalists in [[Nara, Nara|Nara]] but are unable to find Zhou, leaving [[Kyoto]] as the remaining location. Meanwhile, the Saegusa head sends an assassin to kill Zhou in order to destroy any evidence of their coalition. The assassin is killed instead, spurring Mayumi to request Tatsuya's aid in finding his killer. |- !scope="row" |15 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Ancient City Insurrection Arc (II)|古都内乱編＜下＞|Koto Nairan-hen (Ge)|group=Jp.}} |January 10, 2015{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-869167-3/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 15| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-869167-3}} |— |— |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Tatsuya and his companions investigate Zhou's whereabouts in Kyoto and eventually catch and corner him. Zhou then commits suicide, proclaiming someone else will resume his duties. Tatsuya's success forces members of the Yotsuba who despise him to allow Maya to proceed with her plans. |- !scope="row" |16 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Yotsuba Succession Arc|四葉継承編 |Yotsuba Keishō-hen|group=Jp.}} |May 9, 2015{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-865116-5/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 16| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 4, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-865116-5}} |— |— |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Miyuki is summoned to the Yotsuba New Years meeting to commemorate her as the next head of the clan. Several [[bunke]] members of the clan attempt to derail Miyuki's attendance as her succession will elevate Tatsuya's status. Upon their arrival, Miyuki is appointed as the next head, and the origins of Tatsuya and Miyuki's birth is revealed. While they are born from the same [[gamete]]s, Miyuki was genetically modified to act as a seal to his powers. In the next meeting, Maya announces Tatsuya's engagement to Miyuki. |- !scope="row" |17 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Master Clan Conference Arc (I)|師族会議編＜上＞|Shizoku Kaigi-hen (Jō)|group=Jp.}} |August 8, 2015{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-865313-8/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 17| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=August 9, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-865313-8}} |— |— |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Tatsuya and Miyuki adjust to their daily life as their ties to the Yotsuba and engagement have become public knowledge. Meanwhile, a meeting between the master clans take place where they discuss three topics: possible members of the master clan, Tatsuya and Miyuki's marriage, and Saegusa's coalition with the deceased Zhou. Jiedo Heigu, the leader of the organized crime group and Zhou's boss, initiates several bombings against the master clans in order to discredit the magic community. |- !scope="row" |18 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Master Clan Conference Arc (II)|師族会議編＜中＞|Shizoku Kaigi-hen (Chū)|group=Jp.}} |November 10, 2015{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-865512-5/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 18| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=October 26, 2015| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-865512-5}} |— |— |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Jiedo's plan succeeds, inciting several [[hate crime]]s towards magicians throughout the world. The master clans makes plans to quell public outrage as well as attempts to capture Jiedo. The volume ends with Miyuki and her friends defending themselves against a group of anti-magicians. |- !scope="row" |19 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Master Clan Conference Arc (III)|師族会議編＜下＞|Shizoku Kaigi-hen (Ge)|group=Jp.}} |March 10, 2016{{cite web|url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-865809-6/|script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生 19|publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=March 7, 2016| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-865809-6}} |— |— |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Tatsuya arrives and neutralizes the anti-magician group. With Miyuki by his side, Tatsuya uses his full powers to search for Jiedo and relay the location to the Yotsuba. The master clans then assemble a unit to capture Jiedo, who is instead killed by the USNA during the mission. |- |- !scope="row" |20 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|South Sea Riot Arc|南海騒擾編|Nankai Sōjō-hen|group=Jp.}} |September 10, 2016{{cite web|url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-892318-7/|script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生(20)| publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=September 11, 2016| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-892318-7}} |— |— |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|Japan has recently completed an artificial island in Okinawa to mine resources from the ocean. In response, a rebellion cell from the Great Asian Alliance and the Australian military work together to destroy the island in order to keep the world's power in check. The Yotsuba send Tatsuya to pacify the saboteurs and to protect the island. At the same time, the senior class of First High's graduation party is taking place nearby. As the attack on the island commences, members of First High and Tatsuya quell and capture the rebels. |- |- !scope="row" |21 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Prologue of Disturbance Arc (I)|動乱の序章編<上>|Dōran no Joshō-hen |group=Jp.}} |February 10, 2017{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-892669-0/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生(21)|publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=February 8, 2017| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-865809-6}} |— |— |- |colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left"|The Brazilian government's utilization of their strategic magician creates chaos and fear to non-magicians throughout the world, causing a political [[Cold war (general term)|cold war]] to take place. The New Soviet Union mounts an attack on Japan's navy, forcing Tatsuya to intervene. As tensions between the world's superpowers rise, the USNA and New Soviet Union make plans to neutralize Tatsuya. |- |- !scope="row" |22 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Prologue of Disturbance Arc (II)|動乱の序章編<下>|Dōran no Joshō-hen |group=Jp.}} |June 9, 2017{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-892949-3/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生(22)|publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=April 7, 2017| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-892949-3}} |— |— |- | colspan="6" style="background: #FFFFFF; text-align: left" |The Tooyama clan, a magician branch loyal to the government, evaluate Tatsuya as a threat. Several [[black operation|black ops]] led by Tsukasa Tooyama are used to assess Tatsuya's abilities and to determine a countermeasure should he become an enemy of the country. In retaliation, Tatsuya is ordered by Maya to break into the Tooyama stronghold and to free the captured USNA soldiers based within Japan; he succeeds and Tooyama ends her operations, having discovered the Jumonji clan can stop Tatsuya. |- |- !scope="row" |23 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Isolation Arc|孤立編|Koritsu-hen|group=Jp.}} |August 10, 2017{{cite web| url=http://dengekibunko.jp/newreleases/978-4-04-893281-3/| script-title=ja:魔法科高校の劣等生（23）|publisher=[[Dengeki Bunko]]| accessdate=December 24, 2017| language=Japanese}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-893281-3}} |— |— |- !scope="row" |24 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Escape Arc (I)|エスケープ編<上>|Esukēpu-hen |group=Jp.}} |March 10, 2018 |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-893686-6}} |— |— |- !scope="row" |25 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Escape Arc (II)|エスケープ編<下>|Esukēpu-hen |group=Jp.}} |April 10, 2018 |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-893792-4}} |— |— |- !scope="row" |26 |style="text-align: left"|{{Nihongo foot|Invasion Arc|インベージョン編|Inbējon-hen|group=Jp.}} |August 10, 2018 |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-893970-6}} |— |— |- !27 |Sudden Change Arc |November 10, 2018{{Cite news|url=https://dengekibunko.jp/product/mahouka/321807000011.html|title=魔法科高校の劣等生（２７） 急転編 {{!}} 魔法科高校の劣等生 {{!}} 書籍情報 {{!}} 電撃文庫公式サイト|work=電撃文庫公式サイト|access-date=2018-11-02|language=ja}} |{{ISBNT|978-4-04-912163-6}} |— |— |- |} ==Media adaptations== ===Manga=== ''The Irregular at Magic High School'' had several manga adaptations with various artists and publishers; each manga adaptation covered a story arc from the original light novel series. The first adaptation was by [[Fumino Hayashi]] and Tsuna Kitaumi and covered the ''Enrollment Arc'' of the light novels. The latest manga adaptation is drawn by Yuzuki N Dash and covers the ''President Election Arc'' and is currently ongoing. ;Volume list {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" rowspan=2 width="20%"| Story arc title ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" rowspan=2| Author(s) ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" colspan=2| Serialization ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;" colspan=2| Tankōbon |- ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;"| Magazine ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;"| Issues ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;"| Volumes ! scope="column" style="background: #CCF;"| Release range |- !scope="row"| Enrollment Arc |[[Fumino Hayashi]]
